arguments.description: A JSON-serialized list of custom emoji identifiers. At most 200 custom emoji identifiers can be specified.

methods.name: uploadStickerFile
methods.description: Use this method to upload a file with a sticker for later use in the [createNewStickerSet](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#createnewstickerset), [addStickerToSet](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#addstickertoset), or [replaceStickerInSet](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#replacestickerinset) methods (the file can be used multiple times). Returns the uploaded [File](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#file) on success.

arguments.name: user_id
arguments.description: User identifier of sticker file owner

arguments.name: sticker
arguments.description: A file with the sticker in .WEBP, .PNG, .TGS, or .WEBM format. See [https://core.telegram.org/stickers](https://core.telegram.org/stickers) for technical requirements. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#sending-files)

arguments.name: sticker_format
arguments.description: Format of the sticker, must be one of “static”, “animated”, “video”

methods.name: createNewStickerSet
methods.description: Use this method to create a new sticker set owned by a user. The bot will be able to edit the sticker set thus created. Returns *True* on success.

arguments.name: user_id
arguments.description: User identifier of created sticker set owner

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Short name of sticker set, to be used in `t.me/addstickers/` URLs (e.g., *animals*). Can contain only English letters, digits and underscores. Must begin with a letter, can't contain consecutive underscores and must end in `"_by_<bot_username>"`. `<bot_username>` is case insensitive. 1-64 characters.

arguments.name: title
arguments.description: Sticker set title, 1-64 characters

arguments.name: stickers
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized list of 1-50 initial stickers to be added to the sticker set

arguments.name: sticker_type
arguments.description: Type of stickers in the set, pass “regular”, “mask”, or “custom\_emoji”. By default, a regular sticker set is created.

arguments.name: needs_repainting
arguments.description: Pass *True* if stickers in the sticker set must be repainted to the color of text when used in messages, the accent color if used as emoji status, white on chat photos, or another appropriate color based on context; for custom emoji sticker sets only

methods.name: addStickerToSet
methods.description: Use this method to add a new sticker to a set created by the bot. Emoji sticker sets can have up to 200 stickers. Other sticker sets can have up to 120 stickers. Returns *True* on success.

arguments.name: user_id
arguments.description: User identifier of sticker set owner

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Sticker set name

arguments.name: sticker
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized object with information about the added sticker. If exactly the same sticker had already been added to the set, then the set isn't changed.

methods.name: setStickerPositionInSet
methods.description: Use this method to move a sticker in a set created by the bot to a specific position. Returns *True* on success.

arguments.name: sticker
arguments.description: File identifier of the sticker

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: New sticker position in the set, zero-based

methods.name: deleteStickerFromSet
methods.description: Use this method to delete a sticker from a set created by the bot. Returns *True* on success.

arguments.name: sticker
arguments.description: File identifier of the sticker

methods.name: replaceStickerInSet
methods.description: Use this method to replace an existing sticker in a sticker set with a new one. The method is equivalent to calling [deleteStickerFromSet](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#deletestickerfromset), then [addStickerToSet](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#addstickertoset), then [setStickerPositionInSet](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#setstickerpositioninset). Returns *True* on success.

arguments.name: user_id
arguments.description: User identifier of the sticker set owner

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Sticker set name

arguments.name: old_sticker
arguments.description: File identifier of the replaced sticker

arguments.name: sticker
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized object with information about the added sticker. If exactly the same sticker had already been added to the set, then the set remains unchanged.

methods.name: setStickerEmojiList
methods.description: Use this method to change the list of emoji assigned to a regular or custom emoji sticker. The sticker must belong to a sticker set created by the bot. Returns *True* on success.

arguments.name: sticker
arguments.description: File identifier of the sticker

arguments.name: emoji_list
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized list of 1-20 emoji associated with the sticker

methods.name: setStickerKeywords
methods.description: Use this method to change search keywords assigned to a regular or custom emoji sticker. The sticker must belong to a sticker set created by the bot. Returns *True* on success.

arguments.name: sticker
arguments.description: File identifier of the sticker

arguments.name: keywords
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized list of 0-20 search keywords for the sticker with total length of up to 64 characters

methods.name: setStickerMaskPosition
methods.description: Use this method to change the [mask position](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#maskposition) of a mask sticker. The sticker must belong to a sticker set that was created by the bot. Returns *True* on success.

arguments.name: sticker
arguments.description: File identifier of the sticker

arguments.name: mask_position
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized object with the position where the mask should be placed on faces. Omit the parameter to remove the mask position.

methods.name: setStickerSetTitle
methods.description: Use this method to set the title of a created sticker set. Returns *True* on success.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Sticker set name

arguments.name: title
arguments.description: Sticker set title, 1-64 characters

methods.name: setStickerSetThumbnail
methods.description: Use this method to set the thumbnail of a regular or mask sticker set. The format of the thumbnail file must match the format of the stickers in the set. Returns *True* on success.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Sticker set name

arguments.name: user_id
arguments.description: User identifier of the sticker set owner

arguments.name: thumbnail
arguments.description: A **.WEBP** or **.PNG** image with the thumbnail, must be up to 128 kilobytes in size and have a width and height of exactly 100px, or a **.TGS** animation with a thumbnail up to 32 kilobytes in size (see [https://core.telegram.org/stickers#animation-requirements](https://core.telegram.org/stickers#animation-requirements) for animated sticker technical requirements), or a **.WEBM** video with the thumbnail up to 32 kilobytes in size; see [https://core.telegram.org/stickers#video-requirements](https://core.telegram.org/stickers#video-requirements) for video sticker technical requirements. Pass a *file\_id* as a String to send a file that already exists on the Telegram servers, pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or upload a new one using multipart/form-data. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#sending-files). Animated and video sticker set thumbnails can't be uploaded via HTTP URL. If omitted, then the thumbnail is dropped and the first sticker is used as the thumbnail.

arguments.name: format
arguments.description: Format of the thumbnail, must be one of “static” for a **.WEBP** or **.PNG** image, “animated” for a **.TGS** animation, or “video” for a **.WEBM** video

methods.name: setCustomEmojiStickerSetThumbnail
methods.description: Use this method to set the thumbnail of a custom emoji sticker set. Returns *True* on success.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Sticker set name

arguments.name: custom_emoji_id
arguments.description: Custom emoji identifier of a sticker from the sticker set; pass an empty string to drop the thumbnail and use the first sticker as the thumbnail.

methods.name: deleteStickerSet
methods.description: Use this method to delete a sticker set that was created by the bot. Returns *True* on success.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Sticker set name

methods.name: answerInlineQuery
methods.description:
Use this method to send answers to an inline query. On success, *True* is returned.  
No more than **50** results per query are allowed.

arguments.name: inline_query_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the answered query

arguments.name: results
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized array of results for the inline query

arguments.name: cache_time
arguments.description: The maximum amount of time in seconds that the result of the inline query may be cached on the server. Defaults to 300.

arguments.name: is_personal
arguments.description: Pass *True* if results may be cached on the server side only for the user that sent the query. By default, results may be returned to any user who sends the same query.

arguments.name: next_offset
arguments.description: Pass the offset that a client should send in the next query with the same text to receive more results. Pass an empty string if there are no more results or if you don't support pagination. Offset length can't exceed 64 bytes.

arguments.name: button
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized object describing a button to be shown above inline query results

methods.name: answerWebAppQuery
methods.description: Use this method to set the result of an interaction with a [Web App](https://core.telegram.org/bots/webapps) and send a corresponding message on behalf of the user to the chat from which the query originated. On success, a [SentWebAppMessage](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#sentwebappmessage) object is returned.

arguments.name: web_app_query_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the query to be answered

arguments.name: result
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized object describing the message to be sent

methods.name: savePreparedInlineMessage
methods.description: Stores a message that can be sent by a user of a Mini App. Returns a [PreparedInlineMessage](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#preparedinlinemessage) object.

arguments.name: user_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier of the target user that can use the prepared message

arguments.name: result
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized object describing the message to be sent

arguments.name: allow_user_chats
arguments.description: Pass *True* if the message can be sent to private chats with users

arguments.name: allow_bot_chats
arguments.description: Pass *True* if the message can be sent to private chats with bots

arguments.name: allow_group_chats
arguments.description: Pass *True* if the message can be sent to group and supergroup chats

arguments.name: allow_channel_chats
arguments.description: Pass *True* if the message can be sent to channel chats

methods.name: sendInvoice
methods.description: Use this method to send invoices. On success, the sent [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#message) is returned.

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format `@channelusername`)

arguments.name: message_thread_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only

arguments.name: title
arguments.description: Product name, 1-32 characters

arguments.name: description
arguments.description: Product description, 1-255 characters

arguments.name: payload
arguments.description: Bot-defined invoice payload, 1-128 bytes. This will not be displayed to the user, use it for your internal processes.

arguments.name: provider_token
arguments.description: Payment provider token, obtained via [@BotFather](https://t.me/botfather). Pass an empty string for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90).

arguments.name: currency
arguments.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code, see [more on currencies](https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments#supported-currencies). Pass “XTR” for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90).

arguments.name: prices
arguments.description: Price breakdown, a JSON-serialized list of components (e.g. product price, tax, discount, delivery cost, delivery tax, bonus, etc.). Must contain exactly one item for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90).

arguments.name: max_tip_amount
arguments.description: The maximum accepted amount for tips in the *smallest units* of the currency (integer, **not** float/double). For example, for a maximum tip of `US$ 1.45` pass `max_tip_amount = 145`. See the *exp* parameter in [currencies.json](https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments/currencies.json), it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies). Defaults to 0. Not supported for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90).

arguments.name: suggested_tip_amounts
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized array of suggested amounts of tips in the *smallest units* of the currency (integer, **not** float/double). At most 4 suggested tip amounts can be specified. The suggested tip amounts must be positive, passed in a strictly increased order and must not exceed *max\_tip\_amount*.

arguments.name: start_parameter
arguments.description: Unique deep-linking parameter. If left empty, **forwarded copies** of the sent message will have a *Pay* button, allowing multiple users to pay directly from the forwarded message, using the same invoice. If non-empty, forwarded copies of the sent message will have a *URL* button with a deep link to the bot (instead of a *Pay* button), with the value used as the start parameter

arguments.name: provider_data
arguments.description: JSON-serialized data about the invoice, which will be shared with the payment provider. A detailed description of required fields should be provided by the payment provider.

arguments.name: photo_url
arguments.description: URL of the product photo for the invoice. Can be a photo of the goods or a marketing image for a service. People like it better when they see what they are paying for.

arguments.name: photo_size
arguments.description: Photo size in bytes

arguments.name: photo_width
arguments.description: Photo width

arguments.name: photo_height
arguments.description: Photo height

arguments.name: need_name
arguments.description: Pass *True* if you require the user's full name to complete the order. Ignored for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90).

arguments.name: need_phone_number
arguments.description: Pass *True* if you require the user's phone number to complete the order. Ignored for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90).

arguments.name: need_email
arguments.description: Pass *True* if you require the user's email address to complete the order. Ignored for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90).

arguments.name: need_shipping_address
arguments.description: Pass *True* if you require the user's shipping address to complete the order. Ignored for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90).

arguments.name: send_phone_number_to_provider
arguments.description: Pass *True* if the user's phone number should be sent to the provider. Ignored for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90).

arguments.name: send_email_to_provider
arguments.description: Pass *True* if the user's email address should be sent to the provider. Ignored for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90).

arguments.name: is_flexible
arguments.description: Pass *True* if the final price depends on the shipping method. Ignored for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90).

arguments.name: disable_notification
arguments.description: Sends the message [silently](https://telegram.org/blog/channels-2-0#silent-messages). Users will receive a notification with no sound.

arguments.name: protect_content
arguments.description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving

arguments.name: allow_paid_broadcast
arguments.description: Pass *True* to allow up to 1000 messages per second, ignoring [broadcasting limits](https://core.telegram.org/bots/faq#how-can-i-message-all-of-my-bot-39s-subscribers-at-once) for a fee of 0.1 Telegram Stars per message. The relevant Stars will be withdrawn from the bot's balance

arguments.name: message_effect_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier of the message effect to be added to the message; for private chats only

arguments.name: reply_parameters
arguments.description: Description of the message to reply to

arguments.name: reply_markup
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized object for an [inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards). If empty, one 'Pay `total price`' button will be shown. If not empty, the first button must be a Pay button.

methods.name: createInvoiceLink
methods.description: Use this method to create a link for an invoice. Returns the created invoice link as *String* on success.

arguments.name: business_connection_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier of the business connection on behalf of which the link will be created. For payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90) only.

arguments.name: title
arguments.description: Product name, 1-32 characters

arguments.name: description
arguments.description: Product description, 1-255 characters

arguments.name: payload
arguments.description: Bot-defined invoice payload, 1-128 bytes. This will not be displayed to the user, use it for your internal processes.

arguments.name: provider_token
arguments.description: Payment provider token, obtained via [@BotFather](https://t.me/botfather). Pass an empty string for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90).

arguments.name: currency
arguments.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code, see [more on currencies](https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments#supported-currencies). Pass “XTR” for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90).

arguments.name: prices
arguments.description: Price breakdown, a JSON-serialized list of components (e.g. product price, tax, discount, delivery cost, delivery tax, bonus, etc.). Must contain exactly one item for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90).

arguments.name: subscription_period
arguments.description: The number of seconds the subscription will be active for before the next payment. The currency must be set to “XTR” (Telegram Stars) if the parameter is used. Currently, it must always be 2592000 (30 days) if specified. Any number of subscriptions can be active for a given bot at the same time, including multiple concurrent subscriptions from the same user. Subscription price must no exceed 10000 Telegram Stars.

arguments.name: max_tip_amount
arguments.description: The maximum accepted amount for tips in the *smallest units* of the currency (integer, **not** float/double). For example, for a maximum tip of `US$ 1.45` pass `max_tip_amount = 145`. See the *exp* parameter in [currencies.json](https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments/currencies.json), it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies). Defaults to 0. Not supported for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90).

arguments.name: suggested_tip_amounts
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized array of suggested amounts of tips in the *smallest units* of the currency (integer, **not** float/double). At most 4 suggested tip amounts can be specified. The suggested tip amounts must be positive, passed in a strictly increased order and must not exceed *max\_tip\_amount*.

arguments.name: provider_data
arguments.description: JSON-serialized data about the invoice, which will be shared with the payment provider. A detailed description of required fields should be provided by the payment provider.

arguments.name: photo_url
arguments.description: URL of the product photo for the invoice. Can be a photo of the goods or a marketing image for a service.

arguments.name: photo_size
arguments.description: Photo size in bytes

arguments.name: photo_width
arguments.description: Photo width

arguments.name: photo_height
arguments.description: Photo height

arguments.name: need_name
arguments.description: Pass *True* if you require the user's full name to complete the order. Ignored for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90).

arguments.name: need_phone_number
arguments.description: Pass *True* if you require the user's phone number to complete the order. Ignored for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90).

arguments.name: need_email
arguments.description: Pass *True* if you require the user's email address to complete the order. Ignored for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90).

arguments.name: need_shipping_address
arguments.description: Pass *True* if you require the user's shipping address to complete the order. Ignored for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90).

arguments.name: send_phone_number_to_provider
arguments.description: Pass *True* if the user's phone number should be sent to the provider. Ignored for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90).

arguments.name: send_email_to_provider
arguments.description: Pass *True* if the user's email address should be sent to the provider. Ignored for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90).

arguments.name: is_flexible
arguments.description: Pass *True* if the final price depends on the shipping method. Ignored for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90).

methods.name: answerShippingQuery
methods.description: If you sent an invoice requesting a shipping address and the parameter *is\_flexible* was specified, the Bot API will send an [Update](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#update) with a *shipping\_query* field to the bot. Use this method to reply to shipping queries. On success, *True* is returned.

arguments.name: shipping_query_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the query to be answered

arguments.name: ok
arguments.description: Pass *True* if delivery to the specified address is possible and *False* if there are any problems (for example, if delivery to the specified address is not possible)

arguments.name: shipping_options
arguments.description: Required if *ok* is *True*. A JSON-serialized array of available shipping options.

arguments.name: error_message
arguments.description: Required if *ok* is *False*. Error message in human readable form that explains why it is impossible to complete the order (e.g. “Sorry, delivery to your desired address is unavailable”). Telegram will display this message to the user.

methods.name: answerPreCheckoutQuery
methods.description: Once the user has confirmed their payment and shipping details, the Bot API sends the final confirmation in the form of an [Update](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#update) with the field *pre\_checkout\_query*. Use this method to respond to such pre-checkout queries. On success, *True* is returned. **Note:** The Bot API must receive an answer within 10 seconds after the pre-checkout query was sent.

arguments.name: pre_checkout_query_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the query to be answered

arguments.name: ok
arguments.description: Specify *True* if everything is alright (goods are available, etc.) and the bot is ready to proceed with the order. Use *False* if there are any problems.

arguments.name: error_message
arguments.description: Required if *ok* is *False*. Error message in human readable form that explains the reason for failure to proceed with the checkout (e.g. "Sorry, somebody just bought the last of our amazing black T-shirts while you were busy filling out your payment details. Please choose a different color or garment!"). Telegram will display this message to the user.

methods.name: getMyStarBalance
methods.description: A method to get the current Telegram Stars balance of the bot. Requires no parameters. On success, returns a [StarAmount](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#staramount) object.

methods.name: getStarTransactions
methods.description: Returns the bot's Telegram Star transactions in chronological order. On success, returns a [StarTransactions](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#startransactions) object.

arguments.name: offset
arguments.description: Number of transactions to skip in the response

arguments.name: limit
arguments.description: The maximum number of transactions to be retrieved. Values between 1-100 are accepted. Defaults to 100.

methods.name: refundStarPayment
methods.description: Refunds a successful payment in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90). Returns *True* on success.

arguments.name: user_id
arguments.description: Identifier of the user whose payment will be refunded

arguments.name: telegram_payment_charge_id
arguments.description: Telegram payment identifier

methods.name: editUserStarSubscription
methods.description: Allows the bot to cancel or re-enable extension of a subscription paid in Telegram Stars. Returns *True* on success.

arguments.name: user_id
arguments.description: Identifier of the user whose subscription will be edited

arguments.name: telegram_payment_charge_id
arguments.description: Telegram payment identifier for the subscription

arguments.name: is_canceled
arguments.description: Pass *True* to cancel extension of the user subscription; the subscription must be active up to the end of the current subscription period. Pass *False* to allow the user to re-enable a subscription that was previously canceled by the bot.

methods.name: setPassportDataErrors
methods.description:
Informs a user that some of the Telegram Passport elements they provided contains errors. The user will not be able to re-submit their Passport to you until the errors are fixed (the contents of the field for which you returned the error must change). Returns *True* on success.

Use this if the data submitted by the user doesn't satisfy the standards your service requires for any reason. For example, if a birthday date seems invalid, a submitted document is blurry, a scan shows evidence of tampering, etc. Supply some details in the error message to make sure the user knows how to correct the issues.

arguments.name: user_id
arguments.description: User identifier

arguments.name: errors
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized array describing the errors

methods.name: sendGame
methods.description: Use this method to send a game. On success, the sent [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#message) is returned.

arguments.name: business_connection_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier of the business connection on behalf of which the message will be sent

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target chat

arguments.name: message_thread_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread (topic) of the forum; for forum supergroups only

arguments.name: game_short_name
arguments.description: Short name of the game, serves as the unique identifier for the game. Set up your games via [@BotFather](https://t.me/botfather).

arguments.name: disable_notification
arguments.description: Sends the message [silently](https://telegram.org/blog/channels-2-0#silent-messages). Users will receive a notification with no sound.

arguments.name: protect_content
arguments.description: Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving

arguments.name: allow_paid_broadcast
arguments.description: Pass *True* to allow up to 1000 messages per second, ignoring [broadcasting limits](https://core.telegram.org/bots/faq#how-can-i-message-all-of-my-bot-39s-subscribers-at-once) for a fee of 0.1 Telegram Stars per message. The relevant Stars will be withdrawn from the bot's balance

arguments.name: message_effect_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier of the message effect to be added to the message; for private chats only

arguments.name: reply_parameters
arguments.description: Description of the message to reply to

arguments.name: reply_markup
arguments.description: A JSON-serialized object for an [inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards). If empty, one 'Play game\_title' button will be shown. If not empty, the first button must launch the game.

methods.name: setGameScore
methods.description: Use this method to set the score of the specified user in a game message. On success, if the message is not an inline message, the [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#message) is returned, otherwise *True* is returned. Returns an error, if the new score is not greater than the user's current score in the chat and *force* is *False*.

arguments.name: user_id
arguments.description: User identifier

arguments.name: score
arguments.description: New score, must be non-negative

arguments.name: force
arguments.description: Pass *True* if the high score is allowed to decrease. This can be useful when fixing mistakes or banning cheaters

arguments.name: disable_edit_message
arguments.description: Pass *True* if the game message should not be automatically edited to include the current scoreboard

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Required if *inline\_message\_id* is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat

arguments.name: message_id
arguments.description: Required if *inline\_message\_id* is not specified. Identifier of the sent message

arguments.name: inline_message_id
arguments.description: Required if *chat\_id* and *message\_id* are not specified. Identifier of the inline message

methods.name: getGameHighScores
methods.description:
Use this method to get data for high score tables. Will return the score of the specified user and several of their neighbors in a game. Returns an Array of [GameHighScore](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#gamehighscore) objects.

This method will currently return scores for the target user, plus two of their closest neighbors on each side. Will also return the top three users if the user and their neighbors are not among them. Please note that this behavior is subject to change.

arguments.name: user_id
arguments.description: Target user id

arguments.name: chat_id
arguments.description: Required if *inline\_message\_id* is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat

arguments.name: message_id
arguments.description: Required if *inline\_message\_id* is not specified. Identifier of the sent message

arguments.name: inline_message_id
arguments.description: Required if *chat\_id* and *message\_id* are not specified. Identifier of the inline message

objects.name: Update
objects.description:
This [object](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#available-types) represents an incoming update.  
At most **one** of the optional parameters can be present in any given update.

properties.name: update_id
properties.description: The update's unique identifier. Update identifiers start from a certain positive number and increase sequentially. This identifier becomes especially handy if you're using [webhooks](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#setwebhook), since it allows you to ignore repeated updates or to restore the correct update sequence, should they get out of order. If there are no new updates for at least a week, then identifier of the next update will be chosen randomly instead of sequentially.

properties.name: message
properties.description: *Optional*. New incoming message of any kind - text, photo, sticker, etc.

properties.name: edited_message
properties.description: *Optional*. New version of a message that is known to the bot and was edited. This update may at times be triggered by changes to message fields that are either unavailable or not actively used by your bot.

properties.name: channel_post
properties.description: *Optional*. New incoming channel post of any kind - text, photo, sticker, etc.

properties.name: edited_channel_post
properties.description: *Optional*. New version of a channel post that is known to the bot and was edited. This update may at times be triggered by changes to message fields that are either unavailable or not actively used by your bot.

properties.name: business_connection
properties.description: *Optional*. The bot was connected to or disconnected from a business account, or a user edited an existing connection with the bot

properties.name: business_message
properties.description: *Optional*. New message from a connected business account

properties.name: edited_business_message
properties.description: *Optional*. New version of a message from a connected business account

properties.name: deleted_business_messages
properties.description: *Optional*. Messages were deleted from a connected business account

properties.name: message_reaction
properties.description: *Optional*. A reaction to a message was changed by a user. The bot must be an administrator in the chat and must explicitly specify `"message_reaction"` in the list of *allowed\_updates* to receive these updates. The update isn't received for reactions set by bots.

properties.name: message_reaction_count
properties.description: *Optional*. Reactions to a message with anonymous reactions were changed. The bot must be an administrator in the chat and must explicitly specify `"message_reaction_count"` in the list of *allowed\_updates* to receive these updates. The updates are grouped and can be sent with delay up to a few minutes.

properties.name: inline_query
properties.description: *Optional*. New incoming [inline](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inline-mode) query

properties.name: chosen_inline_result
properties.description: *Optional*. The result of an [inline](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inline-mode) query that was chosen by a user and sent to their chat partner. Please see our documentation on the [feedback collecting](https://core.telegram.org/bots/inline#collecting-feedback) for details on how to enable these updates for your bot.

properties.name: callback_query
properties.description: *Optional*. New incoming callback query

properties.name: shipping_query
properties.description: *Optional*. New incoming shipping query. Only for invoices with flexible price

properties.name: pre_checkout_query
properties.description: *Optional*. New incoming pre-checkout query. Contains full information about checkout

properties.name: purchased_paid_media
properties.description: *Optional*. A user purchased paid media with a non-empty payload sent by the bot in a non-channel chat

properties.name: poll
properties.description: *Optional*. New poll state. Bots receive only updates about manually stopped polls and polls, which are sent by the bot

properties.name: poll_answer
properties.description: *Optional*. A user changed their answer in a non-anonymous poll. Bots receive new votes only in polls that were sent by the bot itself.

properties.name: my_chat_member
properties.description: *Optional*. The bot's chat member status was updated in a chat. For private chats, this update is received only when the bot is blocked or unblocked by the user.

properties.name: chat_member
properties.description: *Optional*. A chat member's status was updated in a chat. The bot must be an administrator in the chat and must explicitly specify `"chat_member"` in the list of *allowed\_updates* to receive these updates.

properties.name: chat_join_request
properties.description: *Optional*. A request to join the chat has been sent. The bot must have the *can\_invite\_users* administrator right in the chat to receive these updates.

properties.name: chat_boost
properties.description: *Optional*. A chat boost was added or changed. The bot must be an administrator in the chat to receive these updates.

properties.name: removed_chat_boost
properties.description: *Optional*. A boost was removed from a chat. The bot must be an administrator in the chat to receive these updates.

objects.name: WebhookInfo
objects.description: Describes the current status of a webhook.

properties.name: url
properties.description: Webhook URL, may be empty if webhook is not set up

properties.name: has_custom_certificate
properties.description: *True*, if a custom certificate was provided for webhook certificate checks

properties.name: pending_update_count
properties.description: Number of updates awaiting delivery

properties.name: ip_address
properties.description: *Optional*. Currently used webhook IP address

properties.name: last_error_date
properties.description: *Optional*. Unix time for the most recent error that happened when trying to deliver an update via webhook

properties.name: last_error_message
properties.description: *Optional*. Error message in human-readable format for the most recent error that happened when trying to deliver an update via webhook

properties.name: last_synchronization_error_date
properties.description: *Optional*. Unix time of the most recent error that happened when trying to synchronize available updates with Telegram datacenters

properties.name: max_connections
properties.description: *Optional*. The maximum allowed number of simultaneous HTTPS connections to the webhook for update delivery

properties.name: allowed_updates
properties.description: *Optional*. A list of update types the bot is subscribed to. Defaults to all update types except *chat\_member*

objects.name: User
objects.description: This object represents a Telegram user or bot.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this user or bot. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

properties.name: is_bot
properties.description: *True*, if this user is a bot

properties.name: first_name
properties.description: User's or bot's first name

properties.name: last_name
properties.description: *Optional*. User's or bot's last name

properties.name: username
properties.description: *Optional*. User's or bot's username

properties.name: language_code
properties.description: *Optional*. [IETF language tag](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IETF_language_tag) of the user's language

properties.name: is_premium
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if this user is a Telegram Premium user

properties.name: added_to_attachment_menu
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if this user added the bot to the attachment menu

properties.name: can_join_groups
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the bot can be invited to groups. Returned only in [getMe](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#getme).

properties.name: can_read_all_group_messages
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if [privacy mode](https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#privacy-mode) is disabled for the bot. Returned only in [getMe](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#getme).

properties.name: supports_inline_queries
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the bot supports inline queries. Returned only in [getMe](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#getme).

properties.name: can_connect_to_business
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the bot can be connected to a Telegram Business account to receive its messages. Returned only in [getMe](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#getme).

properties.name: has_main_web_app
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the bot has a main Web App. Returned only in [getMe](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#getme).

objects.name: Chat
objects.description: This object represents a chat.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this chat. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the chat, can be either “private”, “group”, “supergroup” or “channel”

properties.name: title
properties.description: *Optional*. Title, for supergroups, channels and group chats

properties.name: username
properties.description: *Optional*. Username, for private chats, supergroups and channels if available

properties.name: first_name
properties.description: *Optional*. First name of the other party in a private chat

properties.name: last_name
properties.description: *Optional*. Last name of the other party in a private chat

properties.name: is_forum
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the supergroup chat is a forum (has [topics](https://telegram.org/blog/topics-in-groups-collectible-usernames#topics-in-groups) enabled)

objects.name: ChatFullInfo
objects.description: This object contains full information about a chat.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this chat. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the chat, can be either “private”, “group”, “supergroup” or “channel”

properties.name: title
properties.description: *Optional*. Title, for supergroups, channels and group chats

properties.name: username
properties.description: *Optional*. Username, for private chats, supergroups and channels if available

properties.name: first_name
properties.description: *Optional*. First name of the other party in a private chat

properties.name: last_name
properties.description: *Optional*. Last name of the other party in a private chat

properties.name: is_forum
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the supergroup chat is a forum (has [topics](https://telegram.org/blog/topics-in-groups-collectible-usernames#topics-in-groups) enabled)

properties.name: accent_color_id
properties.description: Identifier of the accent color for the chat name and backgrounds of the chat photo, reply header, and link preview. See [accent colors](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#accent-colors) for more details.

properties.name: max_reaction_count
properties.description: The maximum number of reactions that can be set on a message in the chat

properties.name: photo
properties.description: *Optional*. Chat photo

properties.name: active_usernames
properties.description: *Optional*. If non-empty, the list of all [active chat usernames](https://telegram.org/blog/topics-in-groups-collectible-usernames#collectible-usernames); for private chats, supergroups and channels

properties.name: birthdate
properties.description: *Optional*. For private chats, the date of birth of the user

properties.name: business_intro
properties.description: *Optional*. For private chats with business accounts, the intro of the business

properties.name: business_location
properties.description: *Optional*. For private chats with business accounts, the location of the business

properties.name: business_opening_hours
properties.description: *Optional*. For private chats with business accounts, the opening hours of the business

properties.name: personal_chat
properties.description: *Optional*. For private chats, the personal channel of the user

properties.name: available_reactions
properties.description: *Optional*. List of available reactions allowed in the chat. If omitted, then all [emoji reactions](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#reactiontypeemoji) are allowed.

properties.name: background_custom_emoji_id
properties.description: *Optional*. Custom emoji identifier of the emoji chosen by the chat for the reply header and link preview background

properties.name: profile_accent_color_id
properties.description: *Optional*. Identifier of the accent color for the chat's profile background. See [profile accent colors](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#profile-accent-colors) for more details.

properties.name: profile_background_custom_emoji_id
properties.description: *Optional*. Custom emoji identifier of the emoji chosen by the chat for its profile background

properties.name: emoji_status_custom_emoji_id
properties.description: *Optional*. Custom emoji identifier of the emoji status of the chat or the other party in a private chat

properties.name: emoji_status_expiration_date
properties.description: *Optional*. Expiration date of the emoji status of the chat or the other party in a private chat, in Unix time, if any

properties.name: bio
properties.description: *Optional*. Bio of the other party in a private chat

properties.name: has_private_forwards
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if privacy settings of the other party in the private chat allows to use `tg://user?id=<user_id>` links only in chats with the user

properties.name: has_restricted_voice_and_video_messages
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the privacy settings of the other party restrict sending voice and video note messages in the private chat

properties.name: join_to_send_messages
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if users need to join the supergroup before they can send messages

properties.name: join_by_request
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if all users directly joining the supergroup without using an invite link need to be approved by supergroup administrators

properties.name: description
properties.description: *Optional*. Description, for groups, supergroups and channel chats

properties.name: invite_link
properties.description: *Optional*. Primary invite link, for groups, supergroups and channel chats

properties.name: pinned_message
properties.description: *Optional*. The most recent pinned message (by sending date)

properties.name: permissions
properties.description: *Optional*. Default chat member permissions, for groups and supergroups

properties.name: accepted_gift_types
properties.description: Information about types of gifts that are accepted by the chat or by the corresponding user for private chats

properties.name: can_send_paid_media
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if paid media messages can be sent or forwarded to the channel chat. The field is available only for channel chats.

properties.name: slow_mode_delay
properties.description: *Optional*. For supergroups, the minimum allowed delay between consecutive messages sent by each unprivileged user; in seconds

properties.name: unrestrict_boost_count
properties.description: *Optional*. For supergroups, the minimum number of boosts that a non-administrator user needs to add in order to ignore slow mode and chat permissions

properties.name: message_auto_delete_time
properties.description: *Optional*. The time after which all messages sent to the chat will be automatically deleted; in seconds

properties.name: has_aggressive_anti_spam_enabled
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if aggressive anti-spam checks are enabled in the supergroup. The field is only available to chat administrators.

properties.name: has_hidden_members
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if non-administrators can only get the list of bots and administrators in the chat

properties.name: has_protected_content
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if messages from the chat can't be forwarded to other chats

properties.name: has_visible_history
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if new chat members will have access to old messages; available only to chat administrators

properties.name: sticker_set_name
properties.description: *Optional*. For supergroups, name of the group sticker set

properties.name: can_set_sticker_set
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the bot can change the group sticker set

properties.name: custom_emoji_sticker_set_name
properties.description: *Optional*. For supergroups, the name of the group's custom emoji sticker set. Custom emoji from this set can be used by all users and bots in the group.

properties.name: linked_chat_id
properties.description: *Optional*. Unique identifier for the linked chat, i.e. the discussion group identifier for a channel and vice versa; for supergroups and channel chats. This identifier may be greater than 32 bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it is smaller than 52 bits, so a signed 64 bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

properties.name: location
properties.description: *Optional*. For supergroups, the location to which the supergroup is connected

objects.name: Message
objects.description: This object represents a message.

properties.name: message_id
properties.description: Unique message identifier inside this chat. In specific instances (e.g., message containing a video sent to a big chat), the server might automatically schedule a message instead of sending it immediately. In such cases, this field will be 0 and the relevant message will be unusable until it is actually sent

properties.name: message_thread_id
properties.description: *Optional*. Unique identifier of a message thread to which the message belongs; for supergroups only

properties.name: from
properties.description: *Optional*. Sender of the message; may be empty for messages sent to channels. For backward compatibility, if the message was sent on behalf of a chat, the field contains a fake sender user in non-channel chats

properties.name: sender_chat
properties.description: *Optional*. Sender of the message when sent on behalf of a chat. For example, the supergroup itself for messages sent by its anonymous administrators or a linked channel for messages automatically forwarded to the channel's discussion group. For backward compatibility, if the message was sent on behalf of a chat, the field *from* contains a fake sender user in non-channel chats.

properties.name: sender_boost_count
properties.description: *Optional*. If the sender of the message boosted the chat, the number of boosts added by the user

properties.name: sender_business_bot
properties.description: *Optional*. The bot that actually sent the message on behalf of the business account. Available only for outgoing messages sent on behalf of the connected business account.

properties.name: date
properties.description: Date the message was sent in Unix time. It is always a positive number, representing a valid date.

properties.name: business_connection_id
properties.description: *Optional*. Unique identifier of the business connection from which the message was received. If non-empty, the message belongs to a chat of the corresponding business account that is independent from any potential bot chat which might share the same identifier.

properties.name: chat
properties.description: Chat the message belongs to

properties.name: forward_origin
properties.description: *Optional*. Information about the original message for forwarded messages

properties.name: is_topic_message
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the message is sent to a forum topic

properties.name: is_automatic_forward
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the message is a channel post that was automatically forwarded to the connected discussion group

properties.name: reply_to_message
properties.description: *Optional*. For replies in the same chat and message thread, the original message. Note that the Message object in this field will not contain further *reply\_to\_message* fields even if it itself is a reply.

properties.name: external_reply
properties.description: *Optional*. Information about the message that is being replied to, which may come from another chat or forum topic

properties.name: quote
properties.description: *Optional*. For replies that quote part of the original message, the quoted part of the message

properties.name: reply_to_story
properties.description: *Optional*. For replies to a story, the original story

properties.name: via_bot
properties.description: *Optional*. Bot through which the message was sent

properties.name: edit_date
properties.description: *Optional*. Date the message was last edited in Unix time

properties.name: has_protected_content
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the message can't be forwarded

properties.name: is_from_offline
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the message was sent by an implicit action, for example, as an away or a greeting business message, or as a scheduled message

properties.name: media_group_id
properties.description: *Optional*. The unique identifier of a media message group this message belongs to

properties.name: author_signature
properties.description: *Optional*. Signature of the post author for messages in channels, or the custom title of an anonymous group administrator

properties.name: paid_star_count
properties.description: *Optional*. The number of Telegram Stars that were paid by the sender of the message to send it

properties.name: text
properties.description: *Optional*. For text messages, the actual UTF-8 text of the message

properties.name: entities
properties.description: *Optional*. For text messages, special entities like usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc. that appear in the text

properties.name: link_preview_options
properties.description: *Optional*. Options used for link preview generation for the message, if it is a text message and link preview options were changed

properties.name: effect_id
properties.description: *Optional*. Unique identifier of the message effect added to the message

properties.name: animation
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is an animation, information about the animation. For backward compatibility, when this field is set, the *document* field will also be set

properties.name: audio
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is an audio file, information about the file

properties.name: document
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a general file, information about the file

properties.name: paid_media
properties.description: *Optional*. Message contains paid media; information about the paid media

properties.name: photo
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a photo, available sizes of the photo

properties.name: sticker
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a sticker, information about the sticker

properties.name: story
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a forwarded story

properties.name: video
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a video, information about the video

properties.name: video_note
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a [video note](https://telegram.org/blog/video-messages-and-telescope), information about the video message

properties.name: voice
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a voice message, information about the file

properties.name: caption
properties.description: *Optional*. Caption for the animation, audio, document, paid media, photo, video or voice

properties.name: caption_entities
properties.description: *Optional*. For messages with a caption, special entities like usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc. that appear in the caption

properties.name: show_caption_above_media
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the caption must be shown above the message media

properties.name: has_media_spoiler
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the message media is covered by a spoiler animation

properties.name: checklist
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a checklist

properties.name: contact
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a shared contact, information about the contact

properties.name: dice
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a dice with random value

properties.name: game
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a game, information about the game. [More about games »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#games)

properties.name: poll
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a native poll, information about the poll

properties.name: venue
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a venue, information about the venue. For backward compatibility, when this field is set, the *location* field will also be set

properties.name: location
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a shared location, information about the location

properties.name: new_chat_members
properties.description: *Optional*. New members that were added to the group or supergroup and information about them (the bot itself may be one of these members)

properties.name: left_chat_member
properties.description: *Optional*. A member was removed from the group, information about them (this member may be the bot itself)

properties.name: new_chat_title
properties.description: *Optional*. A chat title was changed to this value

properties.name: new_chat_photo
properties.description: *Optional*. A chat photo was change to this value

properties.name: delete_chat_photo
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: the chat photo was deleted

properties.name: group_chat_created
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: the group has been created

properties.name: supergroup_chat_created
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: the supergroup has been created. This field can't be received in a message coming through updates, because bot can't be a member of a supergroup when it is created. It can only be found in reply\_to\_message if someone replies to a very first message in a directly created supergroup.

properties.name: channel_chat_created
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: the channel has been created. This field can't be received in a message coming through updates, because bot can't be a member of a channel when it is created. It can only be found in reply\_to\_message if someone replies to a very first message in a channel.

properties.name: message_auto_delete_timer_changed
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: auto-delete timer settings changed in the chat

properties.name: migrate_to_chat_id
properties.description: *Optional*. The group has been migrated to a supergroup with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

properties.name: migrate_from_chat_id
properties.description: *Optional*. The supergroup has been migrated from a group with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

properties.name: pinned_message
properties.description: *Optional*. Specified message was pinned. Note that the Message object in this field will not contain further *reply\_to\_message* fields even if it itself is a reply.

properties.name: invoice
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is an invoice for a [payment](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#payments), information about the invoice. [More about payments »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#payments)

properties.name: successful_payment
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a service message about a successful payment, information about the payment. [More about payments »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#payments)

properties.name: refunded_payment
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a service message about a refunded payment, information about the payment. [More about payments »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#payments)

properties.name: users_shared
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: users were shared with the bot

properties.name: chat_shared
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: a chat was shared with the bot

properties.name: gift
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: a regular gift was sent or received

properties.name: unique_gift
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: a unique gift was sent or received

properties.name: connected_website
properties.description: *Optional*. The domain name of the website on which the user has logged in. [More about Telegram Login »](https://core.telegram.org/widgets/login)

properties.name: write_access_allowed
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: the user allowed the bot to write messages after adding it to the attachment or side menu, launching a Web App from a link, or accepting an explicit request from a Web App sent by the method [requestWriteAccess](https://core.telegram.org/bots/webapps#initializing-mini-apps)

properties.name: passport_data
properties.description: *Optional*. Telegram Passport data

properties.name: proximity_alert_triggered
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message. A user in the chat triggered another user's proximity alert while sharing Live Location.

properties.name: boost_added
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: user boosted the chat

properties.name: chat_background_set
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: chat background set

properties.name: checklist_tasks_done
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: some tasks in a checklist were marked as done or not done

properties.name: checklist_tasks_added
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: tasks were added to a checklist

properties.name: direct_message_price_changed
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: the price for paid messages in the corresponding direct messages chat of a channel has changed

properties.name: forum_topic_created
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: forum topic created

properties.name: forum_topic_edited
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: forum topic edited

properties.name: forum_topic_closed
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: forum topic closed

properties.name: forum_topic_reopened
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: forum topic reopened

properties.name: general_forum_topic_hidden
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: the 'General' forum topic hidden

properties.name: general_forum_topic_unhidden
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: the 'General' forum topic unhidden

properties.name: giveaway_created
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: a scheduled giveaway was created

properties.name: giveaway
properties.description: *Optional*. The message is a scheduled giveaway message

properties.name: giveaway_winners
properties.description: *Optional*. A giveaway with public winners was completed

properties.name: giveaway_completed
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: a giveaway without public winners was completed

properties.name: paid_message_price_changed
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: the price for paid messages has changed in the chat

properties.name: video_chat_scheduled
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: video chat scheduled

properties.name: video_chat_started
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: video chat started

properties.name: video_chat_ended
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: video chat ended

properties.name: video_chat_participants_invited
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: new participants invited to a video chat

properties.name: web_app_data
properties.description: *Optional*. Service message: data sent by a Web App

properties.name: reply_markup
properties.description: *Optional*. Inline keyboard attached to the message. `login_url` buttons are represented as ordinary `url` buttons.

objects.name: MessageId
objects.description: This object represents a unique message identifier.

properties.name: message_id
properties.description: Unique message identifier. In specific instances (e.g., message containing a video sent to a big chat), the server might automatically schedule a message instead of sending it immediately. In such cases, this field will be 0 and the relevant message will be unusable until it is actually sent

objects.name: InaccessibleMessage
objects.description: This object describes a message that was deleted or is otherwise inaccessible to the bot.

properties.name: chat
properties.description: Chat the message belonged to

properties.name: message_id
properties.description: Unique message identifier inside the chat

properties.name: date
properties.description: Always 0. The field can be used to differentiate regular and inaccessible messages.

objects.name: MaybeInaccessibleMessage
objects.description:
This object describes a message that can be inaccessible to the bot. It can be one of

* [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#message)
* [InaccessibleMessage](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inaccessiblemessage)

objects.name: MessageEntity
objects.description: This object represents one special entity in a text message. For example, hashtags, usernames, URLs, etc.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the entity. Currently, can be “mention” (`@username`), “hashtag” (`#hashtag` or `#hashtag@chatusername`), “cashtag” (`$USD` or `$USD@chatusername`), “bot\_command” (`/start@jobs_bot`), “url” (`https://telegram.org`), “email” (`do-not-reply@telegram.org`), “phone\_number” (`+1-212-555-0123`), “bold” (**bold text**), “italic” (*italic text*), “underline” (underlined text), “strikethrough” (strikethrough text), “spoiler” (spoiler message), “blockquote” (block quotation), “expandable\_blockquote” (collapsed-by-default block quotation), “code” (monowidth string), “pre” (monowidth block), “text\_link” (for clickable text URLs), “text\_mention” (for users [without usernames](https://telegram.org/blog/edit#new-mentions)), “custom\_emoji” (for inline custom emoji stickers)

properties.name: offset
properties.description: Offset in [UTF-16 code units](https://core.telegram.org/api/entities#entity-length) to the start of the entity

properties.name: length
properties.description: Length of the entity in [UTF-16 code units](https://core.telegram.org/api/entities#entity-length)

properties.name: url
properties.description: *Optional*. For “text\_link” only, URL that will be opened after user taps on the text

properties.name: user
properties.description: *Optional*. For “text\_mention” only, the mentioned user

properties.name: language
properties.description: *Optional*. For “pre” only, the programming language of the entity text

properties.name: custom_emoji_id
properties.description: *Optional*. For “custom\_emoji” only, unique identifier of the custom emoji. Use [getCustomEmojiStickers](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#getcustomemojistickers) to get full information about the sticker

objects.name: TextQuote
objects.description: This object contains information about the quoted part of a message that is replied to by the given message.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Text of the quoted part of a message that is replied to by the given message

properties.name: entities
properties.description: *Optional*. Special entities that appear in the quote. Currently, only *bold*, *italic*, *underline*, *strikethrough*, *spoiler*, and *custom\_emoji* entities are kept in quotes.

properties.name: position
properties.description: Approximate quote position in the original message in UTF-16 code units as specified by the sender

properties.name: is_manual
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the quote was chosen manually by the message sender. Otherwise, the quote was added automatically by the server.

objects.name: ExternalReplyInfo
objects.description: This object contains information about a message that is being replied to, which may come from another chat or forum topic.

properties.name: origin
properties.description: Origin of the message replied to by the given message

properties.name: chat
properties.description: *Optional*. Chat the original message belongs to. Available only if the chat is a supergroup or a channel.

properties.name: message_id
properties.description: *Optional*. Unique message identifier inside the original chat. Available only if the original chat is a supergroup or a channel.

properties.name: link_preview_options
properties.description: *Optional*. Options used for link preview generation for the original message, if it is a text message

properties.name: animation
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is an animation, information about the animation

properties.name: audio
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is an audio file, information about the file

properties.name: document
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a general file, information about the file

properties.name: paid_media
properties.description: *Optional*. Message contains paid media; information about the paid media

properties.name: photo
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a photo, available sizes of the photo

properties.name: sticker
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a sticker, information about the sticker

properties.name: story
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a forwarded story

properties.name: video
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a video, information about the video

properties.name: video_note
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a [video note](https://telegram.org/blog/video-messages-and-telescope), information about the video message

properties.name: voice
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a voice message, information about the file

properties.name: has_media_spoiler
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the message media is covered by a spoiler animation

properties.name: checklist
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a checklist

properties.name: contact
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a shared contact, information about the contact

properties.name: dice
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a dice with random value

properties.name: game
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a game, information about the game. [More about games »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#games)

properties.name: giveaway
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a scheduled giveaway, information about the giveaway

properties.name: giveaway_winners
properties.description: *Optional*. A giveaway with public winners was completed

properties.name: invoice
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is an invoice for a [payment](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#payments), information about the invoice. [More about payments »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#payments)

properties.name: location
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a shared location, information about the location

properties.name: poll
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a native poll, information about the poll

properties.name: venue
properties.description: *Optional*. Message is a venue, information about the venue

objects.name: ReplyParameters
objects.description: Describes reply parameters for the message that is being sent.

properties.name: message_id
properties.description: Identifier of the message that will be replied to in the current chat, or in the chat *chat\_id* if it is specified

properties.name: chat_id
properties.description: *Optional*. If the message to be replied to is from a different chat, unique identifier for the chat or username of the channel (in the format `@channelusername`). Not supported for messages sent on behalf of a business account.

properties.name: allow_sending_without_reply
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* if the message should be sent even if the specified message to be replied to is not found. Always *False* for replies in another chat or forum topic. Always *True* for messages sent on behalf of a business account.

properties.name: quote
properties.description: *Optional*. Quoted part of the message to be replied to; 0-1024 characters after entities parsing. The quote must be an exact substring of the message to be replied to, including *bold*, *italic*, *underline*, *strikethrough*, *spoiler*, and *custom\_emoji* entities. The message will fail to send if the quote isn't found in the original message.

properties.name: quote_parse_mode
properties.description: *Optional*. Mode for parsing entities in the quote. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#formatting-options) for more details.

properties.name: quote_entities
properties.description: *Optional*. A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the quote. It can be specified instead of *quote\_parse\_mode*.

properties.name: quote_position
properties.description: *Optional*. Position of the quote in the original message in UTF-16 code units

objects.name: MessageOrigin
objects.description:
This object describes the origin of a message. It can be one of

* [MessageOriginUser](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#messageoriginuser)
* [MessageOriginHiddenUser](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#messageoriginhiddenuser)
* [MessageOriginChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#messageoriginchat)
* [MessageOriginChannel](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#messageoriginchannel)

objects.name: MessageOriginUser
objects.description: The message was originally sent by a known user.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the message origin, always “user”

properties.name: date
properties.description: Date the message was sent originally in Unix time

properties.name: sender_user
properties.description: User that sent the message originally

objects.name: MessageOriginHiddenUser
objects.description: The message was originally sent by an unknown user.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the message origin, always “hidden\_user”

properties.name: date
properties.description: Date the message was sent originally in Unix time

properties.name: sender_user_name
properties.description: Name of the user that sent the message originally

objects.name: MessageOriginChat
objects.description: The message was originally sent on behalf of a chat to a group chat.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the message origin, always “chat”

properties.name: date
properties.description: Date the message was sent originally in Unix time

properties.name: sender_chat
properties.description: Chat that sent the message originally

properties.name: author_signature
properties.description: *Optional*. For messages originally sent by an anonymous chat administrator, original message author signature

objects.name: MessageOriginChannel
objects.description: The message was originally sent to a channel chat.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the message origin, always “channel”

properties.name: date
properties.description: Date the message was sent originally in Unix time

properties.name: chat
properties.description: Channel chat to which the message was originally sent

properties.name: message_id
properties.description: Unique message identifier inside the chat

properties.name: author_signature
properties.description: *Optional*. Signature of the original post author

objects.name: PhotoSize
objects.description: This object represents one size of a photo or a [file](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#document) / [sticker](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#sticker) thumbnail.

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Photo width

properties.name: height
properties.description: Photo height

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: *Optional*. File size in bytes

objects.name: Animation
objects.description: This object represents an animation file (GIF or H.264/MPEG-4 AVC video without sound).

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Video width as defined by the sender

properties.name: height
properties.description: Video height as defined by the sender

properties.name: duration
properties.description: Duration of the video in seconds as defined by the sender

properties.name: thumbnail
properties.description: *Optional*. Animation thumbnail as defined by the sender

properties.name: file_name
properties.description: *Optional*. Original animation filename as defined by the sender

properties.name: mime_type
properties.description: *Optional*. MIME type of the file as defined by the sender

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: *Optional*. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

objects.name: Audio
objects.description: This object represents an audio file to be treated as music by the Telegram clients.

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: duration
properties.description: Duration of the audio in seconds as defined by the sender

properties.name: performer
properties.description: *Optional*. Performer of the audio as defined by the sender or by audio tags

properties.name: title
properties.description: *Optional*. Title of the audio as defined by the sender or by audio tags

properties.name: file_name
properties.description: *Optional*. Original filename as defined by the sender

properties.name: mime_type
properties.description: *Optional*. MIME type of the file as defined by the sender

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: *Optional*. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

properties.name: thumbnail
properties.description: *Optional*. Thumbnail of the album cover to which the music file belongs

objects.name: Document
