objects.description: This object represents a general file (as opposed to [photos](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#photosize), [voice messages](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#voice) and [audio files](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#audio)).

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: thumbnail
properties.description: *Optional*. Document thumbnail as defined by the sender

properties.name: file_name
properties.description: *Optional*. Original filename as defined by the sender

properties.name: mime_type
properties.description: *Optional*. MIME type of the file as defined by the sender

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: *Optional*. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

objects.name: Story
objects.description: This object represents a story.

properties.name: id

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Video width as defined by the sender

properties.name: height

properties.name: file_name

properties.name: mime_type
properties.description: *Optional*. MIME type of the file as defined by the sender

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: *Optional*. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

objects.name: VideoNote
objects.description: This object represents a [video message](https://telegram.org/blog/video-messages-and-telescope) (available in Telegram apps as of [v.4.0](https://telegram.org/blog/video-messages-and-telescope)).

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: duration
properties.description: Duration of the video in seconds as defined by the sender

properties.name: thumbnail
properties.description: *Optional*. Video thumbnail

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: *Optional*. File size in bytes

objects.name: Voice
objects.description: This object represents a voice note.

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: duration
properties.description: Duration of the audio in seconds as defined by the sender

properties.name: mime_type
properties.description: *Optional*. MIME type of the file as defined by the sender

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: *Optional*. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

objects.name: PaidMediaInfo
objects.description: Describes the paid media added to a message.

properties.name: star_count
properties.description: The number of Telegram Stars that must be paid to buy access to the media

properties.name: paid_media
properties.description: Information about the paid media

objects.name: PaidMedia
objects.description:
This object describes paid media. Currently, it can be one of

* [PaidMediaPreview](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#paidmediapreview)
* [PaidMediaPhoto](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#paidmediaphoto)
* [PaidMediaVideo](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#paidmediavideo)

objects.name: PaidMediaPreview
objects.description: The paid media isn't available before the payment.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the paid media, always “preview”

properties.name: width
properties.description: *Optional*. Media width as defined by the sender

properties.name: height
properties.description: *Optional*. Media height as defined by the sender

properties.name: duration
properties.description: *Optional*. Duration of the media in seconds as defined by the sender

objects.name: PaidMediaPhoto
objects.description: The paid media is a photo.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the paid media, always “photo”

properties.name: photo
properties.description: The photo

objects.name: PaidMediaVideo
objects.description: The paid media is a video.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the paid media, always “video”

properties.name: video
properties.description: The video

objects.name: Contact
objects.description: This object represents a phone contact.

properties.name: phone_number
properties.description: Contact's phone number

properties.name: first_name
properties.description: Contact's first name

properties.name: last_name
properties.description: *Optional*. Contact's last name

properties.name: user_id
properties.description: *Optional*. Contact's user identifier in Telegram. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

properties.name: vcard
properties.description: *Optional*. Additional data about the contact in the form of a [vCard](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/VCard)

objects.name: Dice
objects.description: This object represents an animated emoji that displays a random value.

properties.name: emoji
properties.description: Emoji on which the dice throw animation is based

properties.name: value
properties.description: Value of the dice, 1-6 for “🎲”, “🎯” and “🎳” base emoji, 1-5 for “🏀” and “⚽” base emoji, 1-64 for “🎰” base emoji

objects.name: PollOption
objects.description: This object contains information about one answer option in a poll.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Option text, 1-100 characters

properties.name: text_entities
properties.description: *Optional*. Special entities that appear in the option *text*. Currently, only custom emoji entities are allowed in poll option texts

properties.name: voter_count
properties.description: Number of users that voted for this option

objects.name: InputPollOption
objects.description: This object contains information about one answer option in a poll to be sent.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Option text, 1-100 characters

properties.name: text_parse_mode
properties.description: *Optional*. Mode for parsing entities in the text. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#formatting-options) for more details. Currently, only custom emoji entities are allowed

properties.name: text_entities
properties.description: *Optional*. A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the poll option text. It can be specified instead of *text\_parse\_mode*

objects.name: PollAnswer
objects.description: This object represents an answer of a user in a non-anonymous poll.

properties.name: poll_id
properties.description: Unique poll identifier

properties.name: voter_chat
properties.description: *Optional*. The chat that changed the answer to the poll, if the voter is anonymous

properties.name: user
properties.description: *Optional*. The user that changed the answer to the poll, if the voter isn't anonymous

properties.name: option_ids
properties.description: 0-based identifiers of chosen answer options. May be empty if the vote was retracted.

objects.name: Poll
objects.description: This object contains information about a poll.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique poll identifier

properties.name: question
properties.description: Poll question, 1-300 characters

properties.name: question_entities
properties.description: *Optional*. Special entities that appear in the *question*. Currently, only custom emoji entities are allowed in poll questions

properties.name: options
properties.description: List of poll options

properties.name: total_voter_count
properties.description: Total number of users that voted in the poll

properties.name: is_closed
properties.description: *True*, if the poll is closed

properties.name: is_anonymous
properties.description: *True*, if the poll is anonymous

properties.name: type
properties.description: Poll type, currently can be “regular” or “quiz”

properties.name: allows_multiple_answers
properties.description: *True*, if the poll allows multiple answers

properties.name: correct_option_id
properties.description: *Optional*. 0-based identifier of the correct answer option. Available only for polls in the quiz mode, which are closed, or was sent (not forwarded) by the bot or to the private chat with the bot.

properties.name: explanation
properties.description: *Optional*. Text that is shown when a user chooses an incorrect answer or taps on the lamp icon in a quiz-style poll, 0-200 characters

properties.name: explanation_entities
properties.description: *Optional*. Special entities like usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc. that appear in the *explanation*

properties.name: open_period
properties.description: *Optional*. Amount of time in seconds the poll will be active after creation

properties.name: close_date
properties.description: *Optional*. Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the poll will be automatically closed

objects.name: ChecklistTask
objects.description: Describes a task in a checklist.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier of the task

properties.name: text
properties.description: Text of the task

properties.name: text_entities
properties.description: *Optional*. Special entities that appear in the task text

properties.name: completed_by_user
properties.description: *Optional*. User that completed the task; omitted if the task wasn't completed

properties.name: completion_date
properties.description: *Optional*. Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the task was completed; 0 if the task wasn't completed

objects.name: Checklist
objects.description: Describes a checklist.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Title of the checklist

properties.name: title_entities
properties.description: *Optional*. Special entities that appear in the checklist title

properties.name: tasks
properties.description: List of tasks in the checklist

properties.name: others_can_add_tasks
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if users other than the creator of the list can add tasks to the list

properties.name: others_can_mark_tasks_as_done
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if users other than the creator of the list can mark tasks as done or not done

objects.name: InputChecklistTask
objects.description: Describes a task to add to a checklist.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier of the task; must be positive and unique among all task identifiers currently present in the checklist

properties.name: text
properties.description: Text of the task; 1-100 characters after entities parsing

properties.name: parse_mode
properties.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the text. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options) for more details.

properties.name: text_entities
properties.description: *Optional*. List of special entities that appear in the text, which can be specified instead of parse\_mode. Currently, only *bold*, *italic*, *underline*, *strikethrough*, *spoiler*, and *custom\_emoji* entities are allowed.

objects.name: InputChecklist
objects.description: Describes a checklist to create.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Title of the checklist; 1-255 characters after entities parsing

properties.name: parse_mode
properties.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the title. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#formatting-options) for more details.

properties.name: title_entities
properties.description: *Optional*. List of special entities that appear in the title, which can be specified instead of parse\_mode. Currently, only *bold*, *italic*, *underline*, *strikethrough*, *spoiler*, and *custom\_emoji* entities are allowed.

properties.name: tasks
properties.description: List of 1-30 tasks in the checklist

properties.name: others_can_add_tasks
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* if other users can add tasks to the checklist

properties.name: others_can_mark_tasks_as_done
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* if other users can mark tasks as done or not done in the checklist

objects.name: ChecklistTasksDone
objects.description: Describes a service message about checklist tasks marked as done or not done.

properties.name: checklist_message
properties.description: *Optional*. Message containing the checklist whose tasks were marked as done or not done. Note that the Message object in this field will not contain the *reply\_to\_message* field even if it itself is a reply.

properties.name: marked_as_done_task_ids
properties.description: *Optional*. Identifiers of the tasks that were marked as done

properties.name: marked_as_not_done_task_ids
properties.description: *Optional*. Identifiers of the tasks that were marked as not done

objects.name: ChecklistTasksAdded
objects.description: Describes a service message about tasks added to a checklist.

properties.name: checklist_message
properties.description: *Optional*. Message containing the checklist to which the tasks were added. Note that the Message object in this field will not contain the *reply\_to\_message* field even if it itself is a reply.

properties.name: tasks
properties.description: List of tasks added to the checklist

objects.name: Location
objects.description: This object represents a point on the map.

properties.name: latitude
properties.description: Latitude as defined by the sender

properties.name: longitude
properties.description: Longitude as defined by the sender

properties.name: horizontal_accuracy
properties.description: *Optional*. The radius of uncertainty for the location, measured in meters; 0-1500

properties.name: live_period
properties.description: *Optional*. Time relative to the message sending date, during which the location can be updated; in seconds. For active live locations only.

properties.name: heading
properties.description: *Optional*. The direction in which user is moving, in degrees; 1-360. For active live locations only.

properties.name: proximity_alert_radius
properties.description: *Optional*. The maximum distance for proximity alerts about approaching another chat member, in meters. For sent live locations only.

objects.name: Venue
objects.description: This object represents a venue.

properties.name: location
properties.description: Venue location. Can't be a live location

properties.name: title
properties.description: Name of the venue

properties.name: address
properties.description: Address of the venue

properties.name: foursquare_id
properties.description: *Optional*. Foursquare identifier of the venue

properties.name: foursquare_type
properties.description: *Optional*. Foursquare type of the venue. (For example, “arts\_entertainment/default”, “arts\_entertainment/aquarium” or “food/icecream”.)

properties.name: google_place_id
properties.description: *Optional*. Google Places identifier of the venue

properties.name: google_place_type
properties.description: *Optional*. Google Places type of the venue. (See [supported types](https://developers.google.com/places/web-service/supported_types).)

objects.name: WebAppData
objects.description: Describes data sent from a [Web App](https://core.telegram.org/bots/webapps) to the bot.

properties.name: data
properties.description: The data. Be aware that a bad client can send arbitrary data in this field.

properties.name: button_text
properties.description: Text of the *web\_app* keyboard button from which the Web App was opened. Be aware that a bad client can send arbitrary data in this field.

objects.name: ProximityAlertTriggered
objects.description: This object represents the content of a service message, sent whenever a user in the chat triggers a proximity alert set by another user.

properties.name: traveler
properties.description: User that triggered the alert

properties.name: watcher
properties.description: User that set the alert

properties.name: distance
properties.description: The distance between the users

objects.name: MessageAutoDeleteTimerChanged
objects.description: This object represents a service message about a change in auto-delete timer settings.

properties.name: message_auto_delete_time
properties.description: New auto-delete time for messages in the chat; in seconds

objects.name: ChatBoostAdded
objects.description: This object represents a service message about a user boosting a chat.

properties.name: boost_count
properties.description: Number of boosts added by the user

objects.name: BackgroundFill
objects.description:
This object describes the way a background is filled based on the selected colors. Currently, it can be one of

* [BackgroundFillSolid](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#backgroundfillsolid)
* [BackgroundFillGradient](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#backgroundfillgradient)
* [BackgroundFillFreeformGradient](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#backgroundfillfreeformgradient)

objects.name: BackgroundFillSolid
objects.description: The background is filled using the selected color.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the background fill, always “solid”

properties.name: color
properties.description: The color of the background fill in the RGB24 format

objects.name: BackgroundFillGradient
objects.description: The background is a gradient fill.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the background fill, always “gradient”

properties.name: top_color
properties.description: Top color of the gradient in the RGB24 format

properties.name: bottom_color
properties.description: Bottom color of the gradient in the RGB24 format

properties.name: rotation_angle
properties.description: Clockwise rotation angle of the background fill in degrees; 0-359

objects.name: BackgroundFillFreeformGradient
objects.description: The background is a freeform gradient that rotates after every message in the chat.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the background fill, always “freeform\_gradient”

properties.name: colors
properties.description: A list of the 3 or 4 base colors that are used to generate the freeform gradient in the RGB24 format

objects.name: BackgroundType
objects.description:
This object describes the type of a background. Currently, it can be one of

* [BackgroundTypeFill](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#backgroundtypefill)
* [BackgroundTypeWallpaper](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#backgroundtypewallpaper)
* [BackgroundTypePattern](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#backgroundtypepattern)
* [BackgroundTypeChatTheme](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#backgroundtypechattheme)

objects.name: BackgroundTypeFill
objects.description: The background is automatically filled based on the selected colors.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the background, always “fill”

properties.name: fill
properties.description: The background fill

properties.name: dark_theme_dimming
properties.description: Dimming of the background in dark themes, as a percentage; 0-100

objects.name: BackgroundTypeWallpaper
objects.description: The background is a wallpaper in the JPEG format.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the background, always “wallpaper”

properties.name: document
properties.description: Document with the wallpaper

properties.name: dark_theme_dimming
properties.description: Dimming of the background in dark themes, as a percentage; 0-100

properties.name: is_blurred
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the wallpaper is downscaled to fit in a 450x450 square and then box-blurred with radius 12

properties.name: is_moving
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the background moves slightly when the device is tilted

objects.name: BackgroundTypePattern
objects.description: The background is a .PNG or .TGV (gzipped subset of SVG with MIME type “application/x-tgwallpattern”) pattern to be combined with the background fill chosen by the user.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the background, always “pattern”

properties.name: document
properties.description: Document with the pattern

properties.name: fill
properties.description: The background fill that is combined with the pattern

properties.name: intensity
properties.description: Intensity of the pattern when it is shown above the filled background; 0-100

properties.name: is_inverted
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the background fill must be applied only to the pattern itself. All other pixels are black in this case. For dark themes only

properties.name: is_moving
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the background moves slightly when the device is tilted

objects.name: BackgroundTypeChatTheme
objects.description: The background is taken directly from a built-in chat theme.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the background, always “chat\_theme”

properties.name: theme_name
properties.description: Name of the chat theme, which is usually an emoji

objects.name: ChatBackground
objects.description: This object represents a chat background.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the background

objects.name: ForumTopicCreated
objects.description: This object represents a service message about a new forum topic created in the chat.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the topic

properties.name: icon_color
properties.description: Color of the topic icon in RGB format

properties.name: icon_custom_emoji_id
properties.description: *Optional*. Unique identifier of the custom emoji shown as the topic icon

objects.name: ForumTopicClosed
objects.description: This object represents a service message about a forum topic closed in the chat. Currently holds no information.

objects.name: ForumTopicEdited
objects.description: This object represents a service message about an edited forum topic.

properties.name: name
properties.description: *Optional*. New name of the topic, if it was edited

properties.name: icon_custom_emoji_id
properties.description: *Optional*. New identifier of the custom emoji shown as the topic icon, if it was edited; an empty string if the icon was removed

objects.name: ForumTopicReopened
objects.description: This object represents a service message about a forum topic reopened in the chat. Currently holds no information.

objects.name: GeneralForumTopicHidden
objects.description: This object represents a service message about General forum topic hidden in the chat. Currently holds no information.

objects.name: GeneralForumTopicUnhidden
objects.description: This object represents a service message about General forum topic unhidden in the chat. Currently holds no information.

objects.name: SharedUser
objects.description: This object contains information about a user that was shared with the bot using a [KeyboardButtonRequestUsers](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#keyboardbuttonrequestusers) button.

properties.name: user_id
properties.description: Identifier of the shared user. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so 64-bit integers or double-precision float types are safe for storing these identifiers. The bot may not have access to the user and could be unable to use this identifier, unless the user is already known to the bot by some other means.

properties.name: first_name
properties.description: *Optional*. First name of the user, if the name was requested by the bot

properties.name: last_name
properties.description: *Optional*. Last name of the user, if the name was requested by the bot

properties.name: username
properties.description: *Optional*. Username of the user, if the username was requested by the bot

properties.name: photo
properties.description: *Optional*. Available sizes of the chat photo, if the photo was requested by the bot

objects.name: UsersShared
objects.description: This object contains information about the users whose identifiers were shared with the bot using a [KeyboardButtonRequestUsers](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#keyboardbuttonrequestusers) button.

properties.name: request_id
properties.description: Identifier of the request

properties.name: users
properties.description: Information about users shared with the bot.

objects.name: ChatShared
objects.description: This object contains information about a chat that was shared with the bot using a [KeyboardButtonRequestChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#keyboardbuttonrequestchat) button.

properties.name: request_id
properties.description: Identifier of the request

properties.name: chat_id
properties.description: Identifier of the shared chat. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier. The bot may not have access to the chat and could be unable to use this identifier, unless the chat is already known to the bot by some other means.

properties.name: title
properties.description: *Optional*. Title of the chat, if the title was requested by the bot.

properties.name: username
properties.description: *Optional*. Username of the chat, if the username was requested by the bot and available.

properties.name: photo
properties.description: *Optional*. Available sizes of the chat photo, if the photo was requested by the bot

objects.name: WriteAccessAllowed
objects.description: This object represents a service message about a user allowing a bot to write messages after adding it to the attachment menu, launching a Web App from a link, or accepting an explicit request from a Web App sent by the method [requestWriteAccess](https://core.telegram.org/bots/webapps#initializing-mini-apps).

properties.name: from_request
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the access was granted after the user accepted an explicit request from a Web App sent by the method [requestWriteAccess](https://core.telegram.org/bots/webapps#initializing-mini-apps)

properties.name: web_app_name
properties.description: *Optional*. Name of the Web App, if the access was granted when the Web App was launched from a link

properties.name: from_attachment_menu
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the access was granted when the bot was added to the attachment or side menu

objects.name: VideoChatScheduled
objects.description: This object represents a service message about a video chat scheduled in the chat.

properties.name: start_date
properties.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the video chat is supposed to be started by a chat administrator

objects.name: VideoChatStarted
objects.description: This object represents a service message about a video chat started in the chat. Currently holds no information.

objects.name: VideoChatEnded
objects.description: This object represents a service message about a video chat ended in the chat.

properties.name: duration
properties.description: Video chat duration in seconds

objects.name: VideoChatParticipantsInvited
objects.description: This object represents a service message about new members invited to a video chat.

properties.name: users
properties.description: New members that were invited to the video chat

objects.name: PaidMessagePriceChanged
objects.description: Describes a service message about a change in the price of paid messages within a chat.

properties.name: paid_message_star_count
properties.description: The new number of Telegram Stars that must be paid by non-administrator users of the supergroup chat for each sent message

objects.name: DirectMessagePriceChanged
objects.description: Describes a service message about a change in the price of direct messages sent to a channel chat.

properties.name: are_direct_messages_enabled
properties.description: *True*, if direct messages are enabled for the channel chat; false otherwise

properties.name: direct_message_star_count
properties.description: *Optional*. The new number of Telegram Stars that must be paid by users for each direct message sent to the channel. Does not apply to users who have been exempted by administrators. Defaults to 0.

objects.name: GiveawayCreated
objects.description: This object represents a service message about the creation of a scheduled giveaway.

properties.name: prize_star_count
properties.description: *Optional*. The number of Telegram Stars to be split between giveaway winners; for Telegram Star giveaways only

objects.name: Giveaway
objects.description: This object represents a message about a scheduled giveaway.

properties.name: chats
properties.description: The list of chats which the user must join to participate in the giveaway

properties.name: winners_selection_date
properties.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when winners of the giveaway will be selected

properties.name: winner_count
properties.description: The number of users which are supposed to be selected as winners of the giveaway

properties.name: only_new_members
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if only users who join the chats after the giveaway started should be eligible to win

properties.name: has_public_winners
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the list of giveaway winners will be visible to everyone

properties.name: prize_description
properties.description: *Optional*. Description of additional giveaway prize

properties.name: country_codes
properties.description: *Optional*. A list of two-letter [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) country codes indicating the countries from which eligible users for the giveaway must come. If empty, then all users can participate in the giveaway. Users with a phone number that was bought on Fragment can always participate in giveaways.

properties.name: prize_star_count
properties.description: *Optional*. The number of Telegram Stars to be split between giveaway winners; for Telegram Star giveaways only

properties.name: premium_subscription_month_count
properties.description: *Optional*. The number of months the Telegram Premium subscription won from the giveaway will be active for; for Telegram Premium giveaways only

objects.name: GiveawayWinners
objects.description: This object represents a message about the completion of a giveaway with public winners.

properties.name: chat
properties.description: The chat that created the giveaway

properties.name: giveaway_message_id
properties.description: Identifier of the message with the giveaway in the chat

properties.name: winners_selection_date
properties.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when winners of the giveaway were selected

properties.name: winner_count
properties.description: Total number of winners in the giveaway

properties.name: winners
properties.description: List of up to 100 winners of the giveaway

properties.name: additional_chat_count
properties.description: *Optional*. The number of other chats the user had to join in order to be eligible for the giveaway

properties.name: prize_star_count
properties.description: *Optional*. The number of Telegram Stars that were split between giveaway winners; for Telegram Star giveaways only

properties.name: premium_subscription_month_count
properties.description: *Optional*. The number of months the Telegram Premium subscription won from the giveaway will be active for; for Telegram Premium giveaways only

properties.name: unclaimed_prize_count
properties.description: *Optional*. Number of undistributed prizes

properties.name: only_new_members
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if only users who had joined the chats after the giveaway started were eligible to win

properties.name: was_refunded
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the giveaway was canceled because the payment for it was refunded

properties.name: prize_description
properties.description: *Optional*. Description of additional giveaway prize

objects.name: GiveawayCompleted
objects.description: This object represents a service message about the completion of a giveaway without public winners.

properties.name: winner_count
properties.description: Number of winners in the giveaway

properties.name: unclaimed_prize_count
properties.description: *Optional*. Number of undistributed prizes

properties.name: giveaway_message
properties.description: *Optional*. Message with the giveaway that was completed, if it wasn't deleted

properties.name: is_star_giveaway
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the giveaway is a Telegram Star giveaway. Otherwise, currently, the giveaway is a Telegram Premium giveaway.

objects.name: LinkPreviewOptions
objects.description: Describes the options used for link preview generation.

properties.name: is_disabled
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the link preview is disabled

properties.name: url
properties.description: *Optional*. URL to use for the link preview. If empty, then the first URL found in the message text will be used

properties.name: prefer_small_media
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the media in the link preview is supposed to be shrunk; ignored if the URL isn't explicitly specified or media size change isn't supported for the preview

properties.name: prefer_large_media
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the media in the link preview is supposed to be enlarged; ignored if the URL isn't explicitly specified or media size change isn't supported for the preview

properties.name: show_above_text
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the link preview must be shown above the message text; otherwise, the link preview will be shown below the message text

objects.name: UserProfilePhotos
objects.description: This object represent a user's profile pictures.

properties.name: total_count
properties.description: Total number of profile pictures the target user has

properties.name: photos
properties.description: Requested profile pictures (in up to 4 sizes each)

objects.name: File
objects.description:
This object represents a file ready to be downloaded. The file can be downloaded via the link `https://api.telegram.org/file/bot<token>/<file_path>`. It is guaranteed that the link will be valid for at least 1 hour. When the link expires, a new one can be requested by calling [getFile](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#getfile).

The maximum file size to download is 20 MB

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: *Optional*. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.

properties.name: file_path
properties.description: *Optional*. File path. Use `https://api.telegram.org/file/bot<token>/<file_path>` to get the file.

objects.name: WebAppInfo
objects.description: Describes a [Web App](https://core.telegram.org/bots/webapps).

properties.name: url
properties.description: An HTTPS URL of a Web App to be opened with additional data as specified in [Initializing Web Apps](https://core.telegram.org/bots/webapps#initializing-mini-apps)

objects.name: ReplyKeyboardMarkup
objects.description: This object represents a [custom keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#keyboards) with reply options (see [Introduction to bots](https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#keyboards) for details and examples). Not supported in channels and for messages sent on behalf of a Telegram Business account.

properties.name: keyboard
properties.description: Array of button rows, each represented by an Array of [KeyboardButton](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#keyboardbutton) objects

properties.name: is_persistent
properties.description: *Optional*. Requests clients to always show the keyboard when the regular keyboard is hidden. Defaults to *false*, in which case the custom keyboard can be hidden and opened with a keyboard icon.

properties.name: resize_keyboard
properties.description: *Optional*. Requests clients to resize the keyboard vertically for optimal fit (e.g., make the keyboard smaller if there are just two rows of buttons). Defaults to *false*, in which case the custom keyboard is always of the same height as the app's standard keyboard.

properties.name: one_time_keyboard
properties.description: *Optional*. Requests clients to hide the keyboard as soon as it's been used. The keyboard will still be available, but clients will automatically display the usual letter-keyboard in the chat - the user can press a special button in the input field to see the custom keyboard again. Defaults to *false*.

properties.name: input_field_placeholder
properties.description: *Optional*. The placeholder to be shown in the input field when the keyboard is active; 1-64 characters

properties.name: selective
properties.description:
*Optional*. Use this parameter if you want to show the keyboard to specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the *text* of the [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#message) object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply to a message in the same chat and forum topic, sender of the original message.  

*Example:* A user requests to change the bot's language, bot replies to the request with a keyboard to select the new language. Other users in the group don't see the keyboard.

objects.name: KeyboardButton
objects.description: This object represents one button of the reply keyboard. At most one of the optional fields must be used to specify type of the button. For simple text buttons, *String* can be used instead of this object to specify the button text.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Text of the button. If none of the optional fields are used, it will be sent as a message when the button is pressed

properties.name: request_users
properties.description: *Optional.* If specified, pressing the button will open a list of suitable users. Identifiers of selected users will be sent to the bot in a “users\_shared” service message. Available in private chats only.

properties.name: request_chat
properties.description: *Optional.* If specified, pressing the button will open a list of suitable chats. Tapping on a chat will send its identifier to the bot in a “chat\_shared” service message. Available in private chats only.

properties.name: request_contact
properties.description: *Optional*. If *True*, the user's phone number will be sent as a contact when the button is pressed. Available in private chats only.

properties.name: request_location
properties.description: *Optional*. If *True*, the user's current location will be sent when the button is pressed. Available in private chats only.

properties.name: request_poll
properties.description: *Optional*. If specified, the user will be asked to create a poll and send it to the bot when the button is pressed. Available in private chats only.

properties.name: web_app
properties.description: *Optional*. If specified, the described [Web App](https://core.telegram.org/bots/webapps) will be launched when the button is pressed. The Web App will be able to send a “web\_app\_data” service message. Available in private chats only.

objects.name: KeyboardButtonRequestUsers
objects.description: This object defines the criteria used to request suitable users. Information about the selected users will be shared with the bot when the corresponding button is pressed. [More about requesting users »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#chat-and-user-selection)

properties.name: request_id
properties.description: Signed 32-bit identifier of the request that will be received back in the [UsersShared](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#usersshared) object. Must be unique within the message

properties.name: user_is_bot
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* to request bots, pass *False* to request regular users. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

properties.name: user_is_premium
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* to request premium users, pass *False* to request non-premium users. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

properties.name: max_quantity
properties.description: *Optional*. The maximum number of users to be selected; 1-10. Defaults to 1.

properties.name: request_name
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* to request the users' first and last names

properties.name: request_username
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* to request the users' usernames

properties.name: request_photo
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* to request the users' photos

objects.name: KeyboardButtonRequestChat
objects.description: This object defines the criteria used to request a suitable chat. Information about the selected chat will be shared with the bot when the corresponding button is pressed. The bot will be granted requested rights in the chat if appropriate. [More about requesting chats »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#chat-and-user-selection).

properties.name: request_id
properties.description: Signed 32-bit identifier of the request, which will be received back in the [ChatShared](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#chatshared) object. Must be unique within the message

properties.name: chat_is_channel
properties.description: Pass *True* to request a channel chat, pass *False* to request a group or a supergroup chat.

properties.name: chat_is_forum
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* to request a forum supergroup, pass *False* to request a non-forum chat. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

properties.name: chat_has_username
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* to request a supergroup or a channel with a username, pass *False* to request a chat without a username. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

properties.name: chat_is_created
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* to request a chat owned by the user. Otherwise, no additional restrictions are applied.

properties.name: user_administrator_rights
properties.description: *Optional*. A JSON-serialized object listing the required administrator rights of the user in the chat. The rights must be a superset of *bot\_administrator\_rights*. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

properties.name: bot_administrator_rights
properties.description: *Optional*. A JSON-serialized object listing the required administrator rights of the bot in the chat. The rights must be a subset of *user\_administrator\_rights*. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.

properties.name: bot_is_member
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* to request a chat with the bot as a member. Otherwise, no additional restrictions are applied.

properties.name: request_title
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* to request the chat's title

properties.name: request_username
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* to request the chat's username

properties.name: request_photo
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* to request the chat's photo

objects.name: KeyboardButtonPollType
objects.description: This object represents type of a poll, which is allowed to be created and sent when the corresponding button is pressed.

properties.name: type
properties.description: *Optional*. If *quiz* is passed, the user will be allowed to create only polls in the quiz mode. If *regular* is passed, only regular polls will be allowed. Otherwise, the user will be allowed to create a poll of any type.

objects.name: ReplyKeyboardRemove
objects.description: Upon receiving a message with this object, Telegram clients will remove the current custom keyboard and display the default letter-keyboard. By default, custom keyboards are displayed until a new keyboard is sent by a bot. An exception is made for one-time keyboards that are hidden immediately after the user presses a button (see [ReplyKeyboardMarkup](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#replykeyboardmarkup)). Not supported in channels and for messages sent on behalf of a Telegram Business account.

properties.name: remove_keyboard
properties.description: Requests clients to remove the custom keyboard (user will not be able to summon this keyboard; if you want to hide the keyboard from sight but keep it accessible, use *one\_time\_keyboard* in [ReplyKeyboardMarkup](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#replykeyboardmarkup))

properties.name: selective
properties.description:
*Optional*. Use this parameter if you want to remove the keyboard for specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the *text* of the [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#message) object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply to a message in the same chat and forum topic, sender of the original message.  

*Example:* A user votes in a poll, bot returns confirmation message in reply to the vote and removes the keyboard for that user, while still showing the keyboard with poll options to users who haven't voted yet.

objects.name: InlineKeyboardMarkup
objects.description: This object represents an [inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards) that appears right next to the message it belongs to.

properties.name: inline_keyboard
properties.description: Array of button rows, each represented by an Array of [InlineKeyboardButton](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inlinekeyboardbutton) objects

objects.name: InlineKeyboardButton
objects.description: This object represents one button of an inline keyboard. Exactly one of the optional fields must be used to specify type of the button.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Label text on the button

properties.name: url
properties.description: *Optional*. HTTP or tg:// URL to be opened when the button is pressed. Links `tg://user?id=<user_id>` can be used to mention a user by their identifier without using a username, if this is allowed by their privacy settings.

properties.name: callback_data
properties.description: *Optional*. Data to be sent in a [callback query](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#callbackquery) to the bot when the button is pressed, 1-64 bytes

properties.name: web_app
properties.description: *Optional*. Description of the [Web App](https://core.telegram.org/bots/webapps) that will be launched when the user presses the button. The Web App will be able to send an arbitrary message on behalf of the user using the method [answerWebAppQuery](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#answerwebappquery). Available only in private chats between a user and the bot. Not supported for messages sent on behalf of a Telegram Business account.

properties.name: login_url
properties.description: *Optional*. An HTTPS URL used to automatically authorize the user. Can be used as a replacement for the [Telegram Login Widget](https://core.telegram.org/widgets/login).

properties.name: switch_inline_query
properties.description: *Optional*. If set, pressing the button will prompt the user to select one of their chats, open that chat and insert the bot's username and the specified inline query in the input field. May be empty, in which case just the bot's username will be inserted. Not supported for messages sent on behalf of a Telegram Business account.

properties.name: switch_inline_query_current_chat
properties.description:
*Optional*. If set, pressing the button will insert the bot's username and the specified inline query in the current chat's input field. May be empty, in which case only the bot's username will be inserted.  

This offers a quick way for the user to open your bot in inline mode in the same chat - good for selecting something from multiple options. Not supported in channels and for messages sent on behalf of a Telegram Business account.

properties.name: switch_inline_query_chosen_chat
properties.description: *Optional*. If set, pressing the button will prompt the user to select one of their chats of the specified type, open that chat and insert the bot's username and the specified inline query in the input field. Not supported for messages sent on behalf of a Telegram Business account.

properties.name: copy_text
properties.description: *Optional*. Description of the button that copies the specified text to the clipboard.

properties.name: callback_game
properties.description:
*Optional*. Description of the game that will be launched when the user presses the button.  

**NOTE:** This type of button **must** always be the first button in the first row.

properties.name: pay
properties.description:
*Optional*. Specify *True*, to send a [Pay button](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#payments). Substrings “⭐” and “XTR” in the buttons's text will be replaced with a Telegram Star icon.  

**NOTE:** This type of button **must** always be the first button in the first row and can only be used in invoice messages.

objects.name: LoginUrl
objects.description:
This object represents a parameter of the inline keyboard button used to automatically authorize a user. Serves as a great replacement for the [Telegram Login Widget](https://core.telegram.org/widgets/login) when the user is coming from Telegram. All the user needs to do is tap/click a button and confirm that they want to log in:

Telegram apps support these buttons as of [version 5.7](https://telegram.org/blog/privacy-discussions-web-bots#meet-seamless-web-bots).

Sample bot: [@discussbot](https://t.me/discussbot)

properties.name: url
properties.description:
An HTTPS URL to be opened with user authorization data added to the query string when the button is pressed. If the user refuses to provide authorization data, the original URL without information about the user will be opened. The data added is the same as described in [Receiving authorization data](https://core.telegram.org/widgets/login#receiving-authorization-data).  

**NOTE:** You **must** always check the hash of the received data to verify the authentication and the integrity of the data as described in [Checking authorization](https://core.telegram.org/widgets/login#checking-authorization).

properties.name: forward_text
properties.description: *Optional*. New text of the button in forwarded messages.

properties.name: bot_username
properties.description: *Optional*. Username of a bot, which will be used for user authorization. See [Setting up a bot](https://core.telegram.org/widgets/login#setting-up-a-bot) for more details. If not specified, the current bot's username will be assumed. The *url*'s domain must be the same as the domain linked with the bot. See [Linking your domain to the bot](https://core.telegram.org/widgets/login#linking-your-domain-to-the-bot) for more details.

properties.name: request_write_access
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* to request the permission for your bot to send messages to the user.

objects.name: SwitchInlineQueryChosenChat
objects.description: This object represents an inline button that switches the current user to inline mode in a chosen chat, with an optional default inline query.

properties.name: query
properties.description: *Optional*. The default inline query to be inserted in the input field. If left empty, only the bot's username will be inserted

properties.name: allow_user_chats
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if private chats with users can be chosen

properties.name: allow_bot_chats
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if private chats with bots can be chosen

properties.name: allow_group_chats
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if group and supergroup chats can be chosen

properties.name: allow_channel_chats
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if channel chats can be chosen

objects.name: CopyTextButton
objects.description: This object represents an inline keyboard button that copies specified text to the clipboard.

properties.name: text
properties.description: The text to be copied to the clipboard; 1-256 characters

objects.name: CallbackQuery
objects.description: This object represents an incoming callback query from a callback button in an [inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards). If the button that originated the query was attached to a message sent by the bot, the field *message* will be present. If the button was attached to a message sent via the bot (in [inline mode](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inline-mode)), the field *inline\_message\_id* will be present. Exactly one of the fields *data* or *game\_short\_name* will be present.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this query

properties.name: from
properties.description: Sender

properties.name: message
properties.description: *Optional*. Message sent by the bot with the callback button that originated the query

properties.name: inline_message_id
properties.description: *Optional*. Identifier of the message sent via the bot in inline mode, that originated the query.

properties.name: chat_instance
properties.description: Global identifier, uniquely corresponding to the chat to which the message with the callback button was sent. Useful for high scores in [games](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#games).

properties.name: data
properties.description: *Optional*. Data associated with the callback button. Be aware that the message originated the query can contain no callback buttons with this data.

properties.name: game_short_name
properties.description: *Optional*. Short name of a [Game](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#games) to be returned, serves as the unique identifier for the game

objects.name: ForceReply
objects.description: Upon receiving a message with this object, Telegram clients will display a reply interface to the user (act as if the user has selected the bot's message and tapped 'Reply'). This can be extremely useful if you want to create user-friendly step-by-step interfaces without having to sacrifice [privacy mode](https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#privacy-mode). Not supported in channels and for messages sent on behalf of a Telegram Business account.

properties.name: force_reply
properties.description: Shows reply interface to the user, as if they manually selected the bot's message and tapped 'Reply'

properties.name: input_field_placeholder
properties.description: *Optional*. The placeholder to be shown in the input field when the reply is active; 1-64 characters

properties.name: selective
properties.description: *Optional*. Use this parameter if you want to force reply from specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the *text* of the [Message](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#message) object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply to a message in the same chat and forum topic, sender of the original message.

objects.name: ChatPhoto
objects.description: This object represents a chat photo.

properties.name: small_file_id
properties.description: File identifier of small (160x160) chat photo. This file\_id can be used only for photo download and only for as long as the photo is not changed.

properties.name: small_file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique file identifier of small (160x160) chat photo, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: big_file_id
properties.description: File identifier of big (640x640) chat photo. This file\_id can be used only for photo download and only for as long as the photo is not changed.

properties.name: big_file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique file identifier of big (640x640) chat photo, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

objects.name: ChatInviteLink
objects.description: Represents an invite link for a chat.

properties.name: invite_link
properties.description: The invite link. If the link was created by another chat administrator, then the second part of the link will be replaced with “…”.

properties.name: creator
properties.description: Creator of the link

properties.name: creates_join_request
properties.description: *True*, if users joining the chat via the link need to be approved by chat administrators

properties.name: is_primary
properties.description: *True*, if the link is primary

properties.name: is_revoked
properties.description: *True*, if the link is revoked

properties.name: name
properties.description: *Optional*. Invite link name

properties.name: expire_date
properties.description: *Optional*. Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the link will expire or has been expired

properties.name: member_limit
properties.description: *Optional*. The maximum number of users that can be members of the chat simultaneously after joining the chat via this invite link; 1-99999

properties.name: pending_join_request_count
properties.description: *Optional*. Number of pending join requests created using this link

properties.name: subscription_period
properties.description: *Optional*. The number of seconds the subscription will be active for before the next payment

properties.name: subscription_price
properties.description: *Optional*. The amount of Telegram Stars a user must pay initially and after each subsequent subscription period to be a member of the chat using the link

objects.name: ChatAdministratorRights
objects.description: Represents the rights of an administrator in a chat.

properties.name: is_anonymous
properties.description: *True*, if the user's presence in the chat is hidden

properties.name: can_manage_chat
properties.description: *True*, if the administrator can access the chat event log, get boost list, see hidden supergroup and channel members, report spam messages, ignore slow mode, and send messages to the chat without paying Telegram Stars. Implied by any other administrator privilege.

properties.name: can_delete_messages
properties.description: *True*, if the administrator can delete messages of other users

properties.name: can_manage_video_chats
properties.description: *True*, if the administrator can manage video chats

properties.name: can_restrict_members
properties.description: *True*, if the administrator can restrict, ban or unban chat members, or access supergroup statistics

properties.name: can_promote_members
properties.description: *True*, if the administrator can add new administrators with a subset of their own privileges or demote administrators that they have promoted, directly or indirectly (promoted by administrators that were appointed by the user)

properties.name: can_change_info
properties.description: *True*, if the user is allowed to change the chat title, photo and other settings

properties.name: can_invite_users
properties.description: *True*, if the user is allowed to invite new users to the chat

properties.name: can_post_stories
properties.description: *True*, if the administrator can post stories to the chat

properties.name: can_edit_stories
properties.description: *True*, if the administrator can edit stories posted by other users, post stories to the chat page, pin chat stories, and access the chat's story archive

properties.name: can_delete_stories
properties.description: *True*, if the administrator can delete stories posted by other users

properties.name: can_post_messages
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the administrator can post messages in the channel, approve suggested posts, or access channel statistics; for channels only

properties.name: can_edit_messages
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the administrator can edit messages of other users and can pin messages; for channels only

properties.name: can_pin_messages
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the user is allowed to pin messages; for groups and supergroups only

properties.name: can_manage_topics
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the user is allowed to create, rename, close, and reopen forum topics; for supergroups only

objects.name: ChatMemberUpdated
objects.description: This object represents changes in the status of a chat member.

properties.name: chat
properties.description: Chat the user belongs to

properties.name: from
properties.description: Performer of the action, which resulted in the change

properties.name: date
properties.description: Date the change was done in Unix time

properties.name: old_chat_member
properties.description: Previous information about the chat member

properties.name: new_chat_member
properties.description: New information about the chat member

properties.name: invite_link
properties.description: *Optional*. Chat invite link, which was used by the user to join the chat; for joining by invite link events only.

properties.name: via_join_request
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the user joined the chat after sending a direct join request without using an invite link and being approved by an administrator

properties.name: via_chat_folder_invite_link
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the user joined the chat via a chat folder invite link

objects.name: ChatMember
objects.description:
This object contains information about one member of a chat. Currently, the following 6 types of chat members are supported:

* [ChatMemberOwner](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#chatmemberowner)
* [ChatMemberAdministrator](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#chatmemberadministrator)
* [ChatMemberMember](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#chatmembermember)
* [ChatMemberRestricted](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#chatmemberrestricted)
* [ChatMemberLeft](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#chatmemberleft)
* [ChatMemberBanned](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#chatmemberbanned)

objects.name: ChatMemberOwner
objects.description: Represents a [chat member](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#chatmember) that owns the chat and has all administrator privileges.

properties.name: status
properties.description: The member's status in the chat, always “creator”

properties.name: user
properties.description: Information about the user

properties.name: is_anonymous
properties.description: *True*, if the user's presence in the chat is hidden

properties.name: custom_title
properties.description: *Optional*. Custom title for this user

objects.name: ChatMemberAdministrator
objects.description: Represents a [chat member](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#chatmember) that has some additional privileges.

properties.name: status
properties.description: The member's status in the chat, always “administrator”

properties.name: user
properties.description: Information about the user

properties.name: can_be_edited
properties.description: *True*, if the bot is allowed to edit administrator privileges of that user

properties.name: is_anonymous
properties.description: *True*, if the user's presence in the chat is hidden

properties.name: can_manage_chat
properties.description: *True*, if the administrator can access the chat event log, get boost list, see hidden supergroup and channel members, report spam messages, ignore slow mode, and send messages to the chat without paying Telegram Stars. Implied by any other administrator privilege.

properties.name: can_delete_messages
properties.description: *True*, if the administrator can delete messages of other users

properties.name: can_manage_video_chats
properties.description: *True*, if the administrator can manage video chats

properties.name: can_restrict_members
properties.description: *True*, if the administrator can restrict, ban or unban chat members, or access supergroup statistics

properties.name: can_promote_members
properties.description: *True*, if the administrator can add new administrators with a subset of their own privileges or demote administrators that they have promoted, directly or indirectly (promoted by administrators that were appointed by the user)

properties.name: can_change_info
properties.description: *True*, if the user is allowed to change the chat title, photo and other settings

properties.name: can_invite_users
properties.description: *True*, if the user is allowed to invite new users to the chat

properties.name: can_post_stories
properties.description: *True*, if the administrator can post stories to the chat

properties.name: can_edit_stories
properties.description: *True*, if the administrator can edit stories posted by other users, post stories to the chat page, pin chat stories, and access the chat's story archive

properties.name: can_delete_stories
properties.description: *True*, if the administrator can delete stories posted by other users

properties.name: can_post_messages
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the administrator can post messages in the channel, approve suggested posts, or access channel statistics; for channels only

properties.name: can_edit_messages
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the administrator can edit messages of other users and can pin messages; for channels only

properties.name: can_pin_messages
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the user is allowed to pin messages; for groups and supergroups only

properties.name: can_manage_topics
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the user is allowed to create, rename, close, and reopen forum topics; for supergroups only

properties.name: custom_title
properties.description: *Optional*. Custom title for this user

objects.name: ChatMemberMember
objects.description: Represents a [chat member](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#chatmember) that has no additional privileges or restrictions.

properties.name: status
properties.description: The member's status in the chat, always “member”

properties.name: user
properties.description: Information about the user

properties.name: until_date
properties.description: *Optional*. Date when the user's subscription will expire; Unix time

objects.name: ChatMemberRestricted
objects.description: Represents a [chat member](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#chatmember) that is under certain restrictions in the chat. Supergroups only.

properties.name: status
properties.description: The member's status in the chat, always “restricted”

properties.name: user
properties.description: Information about the user

properties.name: is_member
properties.description: *True*, if the user is a member of the chat at the moment of the request

properties.name: can_send_messages
properties.description: *True*, if the user is allowed to send text messages, contacts, giveaways, giveaway winners, invoices, locations and venues

properties.name: can_send_audios
properties.description: *True*, if the user is allowed to send audios

properties.name: can_send_documents
properties.description: *True*, if the user is allowed to send documents

properties.name: can_send_photos
properties.description: *True*, if the user is allowed to send photos

properties.name: can_send_videos
properties.description: *True*, if the user is allowed to send videos

properties.name: can_send_video_notes

objects.name: ChatJoinRequest
objects.description: Represents a join request sent to a chat.

properties.name: chat
properties.description: Chat to which the request was sent

properties.name: from
properties.description: User that sent the join request

properties.name: user_chat_id
properties.description: Identifier of a private chat with the user who sent the join request. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier. The bot can use this identifier for 5 minutes to send messages until the join request is processed, assuming no other administrator contacted the user.

properties.name: date
properties.description: Date the request was sent in Unix time

properties.name: bio
properties.description: *Optional*. Bio of the user.

properties.name: invite_link
properties.description: *Optional*. Chat invite link that was used by the user to send the join request

objects.name: ChatPermissions

properties.name: can_send_polls

properties.name: can_send_other_messages
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the user is allowed to send animations, games, stickers and use inline bots

properties.name: can_add_web_page_previews
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the user is allowed to add web page previews to their messages

properties.name: can_change_info
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the user is allowed to change the chat title, photo and other settings. Ignored in public supergroups

properties.name: can_invite_users
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the user is allowed to invite new users to the chat

properties.name: can_pin_messages

objects.name: StoryAreaType
objects.description:
Describes the type of a clickable area on a story. Currently, it can be one of

* [StoryAreaTypeLocation](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#storyareatypelocation)
* [StoryAreaTypeSuggestedReaction](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#storyareatypesuggestedreaction)
* [StoryAreaTypeLink](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#storyareatypelink)
* [StoryAreaTypeWeather](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#storyareatypeweather)
* [StoryAreaTypeUniqueGift](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#storyareatypeuniquegift)

objects.name: StoryAreaTypeLocation
objects.description: Describes a story area pointing to a location. Currently, a story can have up to 10 location areas.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the area, always “location”

properties.name: latitude
properties.description: Location latitude in degrees

properties.name: longitude
properties.description: Location longitude in degrees

properties.name: address
properties.description: *Optional*. Address of the location

objects.name: StoryAreaTypeSuggestedReaction
objects.description: Describes a story area pointing to a suggested reaction. Currently, a story can have up to 5 suggested reaction areas.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the area, always “suggested\_reaction”

properties.name: reaction_type
properties.description: Type of the reaction

properties.name: is_dark
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* if the reaction area has a dark background

properties.name: is_flipped
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* if reaction area corner is flipped

objects.name: StoryAreaTypeLink
objects.description: Describes a story area pointing to an HTTP or tg:// link. Currently, a story can have up to 3 link areas.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the area, always “link”

properties.name: url
properties.description: HTTP or tg:// URL to be opened when the area is clicked

objects.name: StoryAreaTypeWeather
objects.description: Describes a story area containing weather information. Currently, a story can have up to 3 weather areas.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the area, always “weather”

properties.name: temperature
properties.description: Temperature, in degree Celsius

properties.name: emoji
properties.description: Emoji representing the weather

properties.name: background_color
properties.description: A color of the area background in the ARGB format

objects.name: StoryAreaTypeUniqueGift
objects.description: Describes a story area pointing to a unique gift. Currently, a story can have at most 1 unique gift area.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the area, always “unique\_gift”

properties.name: name
properties.description: Unique name of the gift

objects.name: StoryArea
objects.description: Describes a clickable area on a story media.

properties.name: position

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the area

properties.name: address
properties.description: Location address; 1-64 characters, as defined by the chat owner

objects.name: ReactionType
objects.description:
This object describes the type of a reaction. Currently, it can be one of

* [ReactionTypeEmoji](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#reactiontypeemoji)
* [ReactionTypeCustomEmoji](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#reactiontypecustomemoji)
* [ReactionTypePaid](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#reactiontypepaid)

objects.name: ReactionTypeEmoji
objects.description: The reaction is based on an emoji.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the reaction, always “emoji”

objects.name: ReactionTypeCustomEmoji
objects.description: The reaction is based on a custom emoji.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the reaction, always “custom\_emoji”

properties.name: custom_emoji_id
properties.description: Custom emoji identifier

objects.name: ReactionTypePaid
objects.description: The reaction is paid.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the reaction, always “paid”

objects.name: ReactionCount
objects.description: Represents a reaction added to a message along with the number of times it was added.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the reaction

properties.name: total_count
properties.description: Number of times the reaction was added

objects.name: MessageReactionUpdated

properties.name: message_id
properties.description: Unique identifier of the message inside the chat

properties.name: user
properties.description: *Optional*. The user that changed the reaction, if the user isn't anonymous

properties.name: actor_chat
properties.description: *Optional*. The chat on behalf of which the reaction was changed, if the user is anonymous

properties.name: date
properties.description: Date of the change in Unix time

properties.name: old_reaction
properties.description: Previous list of reaction types that were set by the user

properties.name: new_reaction
properties.description: New list of reaction types that have been set by the user

objects.name: MessageReactionCountUpdated
objects.description: This object represents reaction changes on a message with anonymous reactions.

properties.name: chat
properties.description: The chat containing the message

properties.name: message_id
properties.description: Unique message identifier inside the chat

properties.name: date
properties.description: Date of the change in Unix time

properties.name: reactions
properties.description: List of reactions that are present on the message

objects.name: ForumTopic

objects.name: Gift

properties.name: remaining_count
