properties.name: name
properties.description: Unique name of the gift. This name can be used in `https://t.me/nft/...` links and story areas

properties.name: number
properties.description: Unique number of the upgraded gift among gifts upgraded from the same regular gift

properties.name: model
properties.description: Model of the gift

properties.name: symbol
properties.description: Symbol of the gift

properties.name: backdrop
properties.description: Backdrop of the gift

objects.name: GiftInfo
objects.description: Describes a service message about a regular gift that was sent or received.

properties.name: gift
properties.description: Information about the gift

properties.name: owned_gift_id
properties.description: *Optional*. Unique identifier of the received gift for the bot; only present for gifts received on behalf of business accounts

properties.name: convert_star_count
properties.description: *Optional*. Number of Telegram Stars that can be claimed by the receiver by converting the gift; omitted if conversion to Telegram Stars is impossible

properties.name: prepaid_upgrade_star_count
properties.description: *Optional*. Number of Telegram Stars that were prepaid by the sender for the ability to upgrade the gift

properties.name: can_be_upgraded
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the gift can be upgraded to a unique gift

properties.name: text
properties.description: *Optional*. Text of the message that was added to the gift

properties.name: entities
properties.description: *Optional*. Special entities that appear in the text

properties.name: is_private
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the sender and gift text are shown only to the gift receiver; otherwise, everyone will be able to see them

objects.name: UniqueGiftInfo
objects.description: Describes a service message about a unique gift that was sent or received.

properties.name: gift
properties.description: Information about the gift

properties.name: origin
properties.description: Origin of the gift. Currently, either “upgrade” for gifts upgraded from regular gifts, “transfer” for gifts transferred from other users or channels, or “resale” for gifts bought from other users

properties.name: last_resale_star_count
properties.description: *Optional*. For gifts bought from other users, the price paid for the gift

properties.name: owned_gift_id
properties.description: *Optional*. Unique identifier of the received gift for the bot; only present for gifts received on behalf of business accounts

properties.name: transfer_star_count
properties.description: *Optional*. Number of Telegram Stars that must be paid to transfer the gift; omitted if the bot cannot transfer the gift

properties.name: next_transfer_date
properties.description: *Optional*. Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the gift can be transferred. If it is in the past, then the gift can be transferred now

objects.name: OwnedGift
objects.description:
This object describes a gift received and owned by a user or a chat. Currently, it can be one of

* [OwnedGiftRegular](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#ownedgiftregular)
* [OwnedGiftUnique](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#ownedgiftunique)

objects.name: OwnedGiftRegular
objects.description: Describes a regular gift owned by a user or a chat.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the gift, always “regular”

properties.name: gift
properties.description: Information about the regular gift

properties.name: owned_gift_id
properties.description: *Optional*. Unique identifier of the gift for the bot; for gifts received on behalf of business accounts only

properties.name: sender_user
properties.description: *Optional*. Sender of the gift if it is a known user

properties.name: send_date
properties.description: Date the gift was sent in Unix time

properties.name: text
properties.description: *Optional*. Text of the message that was added to the gift

properties.name: entities
properties.description: *Optional*. Special entities that appear in the text

properties.name: is_private
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the sender and gift text are shown only to the gift receiver; otherwise, everyone will be able to see them

properties.name: is_saved
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the gift is displayed on the account's profile page; for gifts received on behalf of business accounts only

properties.name: can_be_upgraded
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the gift can be upgraded to a unique gift; for gifts received on behalf of business accounts only

properties.name: was_refunded
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the gift was refunded and isn't available anymore

properties.name: convert_star_count
properties.description: *Optional*. Number of Telegram Stars that can be claimed by the receiver instead of the gift; omitted if the gift cannot be converted to Telegram Stars

properties.name: prepaid_upgrade_star_count
properties.description: *Optional*. Number of Telegram Stars that were paid by the sender for the ability to upgrade the gift

objects.name: OwnedGiftUnique
objects.description: Describes a unique gift received and owned by a user or a chat.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the gift, always “unique”

properties.name: gift
properties.description: Information about the unique gift

properties.name: owned_gift_id
properties.description: *Optional*. Unique identifier of the received gift for the bot; for gifts received on behalf of business accounts only

properties.name: sender_user
properties.description: *Optional*. Sender of the gift if it is a known user

properties.name: send_date
properties.description: Date the gift was sent in Unix time

properties.name: is_saved
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the gift is displayed on the account's profile page; for gifts received on behalf of business accounts only

properties.name: can_be_transferred
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the gift can be transferred to another owner; for gifts received on behalf of business accounts only

properties.name: transfer_star_count
properties.description: *Optional*. Number of Telegram Stars that must be paid to transfer the gift; omitted if the bot cannot transfer the gift

properties.name: next_transfer_date
properties.description: *Optional*. Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the gift can be transferred. If it is in the past, then the gift can be transferred now

objects.name: OwnedGifts
objects.description: Contains the list of gifts received and owned by a user or a chat.

properties.name: total_count
properties.description: The total number of gifts owned by the user or the chat

properties.name: gifts
properties.description: The list of gifts

properties.name: next_offset
properties.description: *Optional*. Offset for the next request. If empty, then there are no more results

objects.name: AcceptedGiftTypes
objects.description: This object describes the types of gifts that can be gifted to a user or a chat.

properties.name: unlimited_gifts
properties.description: *True*, if unlimited regular gifts are accepted

properties.name: limited_gifts
properties.description: *True*, if limited regular gifts are accepted

properties.name: unique_gifts
properties.description: *True*, if unique gifts or gifts that can be upgraded to unique for free are accepted

properties.name: premium_subscription
properties.description: *True*, if a Telegram Premium subscription is accepted

objects.name: StarAmount
objects.description: Describes an amount of Telegram Stars.

properties.name: amount
properties.description: Integer amount of Telegram Stars, rounded to 0; can be negative

properties.name: nanostar_amount
properties.description: *Optional*. The number of 1/1000000000 shares of Telegram Stars; from -999999999 to 999999999; can be negative if and only if *amount* is non-positive

objects.name: BotCommand
objects.description: This object represents a bot command.

properties.name: command
properties.description: Text of the command; 1-32 characters. Can contain only lowercase English letters, digits and underscores.

properties.name: description
properties.description: Description of the command; 1-256 characters.

objects.name: BotCommandScope
objects.description:
This object represents the scope to which bot commands are applied. Currently, the following 7 scopes are supported:

* [BotCommandScopeDefault](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#botcommandscopedefault)
* [BotCommandScopeAllPrivateChats](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#botcommandscopeallprivatechats)
* [BotCommandScopeAllGroupChats](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#botcommandscopeallgroupchats)
* [BotCommandScopeAllChatAdministrators](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#botcommandscopeallchatadministrators)
* [BotCommandScopeChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#botcommandscopechat)
* [BotCommandScopeChatAdministrators](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#botcommandscopechatadministrators)
* [BotCommandScopeChatMember](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#botcommandscopechatmember)

objects.name: BotCommandScopeDefault
objects.description: Represents the default [scope](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#botcommandscope) of bot commands. Default commands are used if no commands with a [narrower scope](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#determining-list-of-commands) are specified for the user.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Scope type, must be *default*

objects.name: BotCommandScopeAllPrivateChats
objects.description: Represents the [scope](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#botcommandscope) of bot commands, covering all private chats.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Scope type, must be *all\_private\_chats*

objects.name: BotCommandScopeAllGroupChats
objects.description: Represents the [scope](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#botcommandscope) of bot commands, covering all group and supergroup chats.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Scope type, must be *all\_group\_chats*

objects.name: BotCommandScopeAllChatAdministrators
objects.description: Represents the [scope](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#botcommandscope) of bot commands, covering all group and supergroup chat administrators.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Scope type, must be *all\_chat\_administrators*

objects.name: BotCommandScopeChat
objects.description: Represents the [scope](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#botcommandscope) of bot commands, covering a specific chat.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Scope type, must be *chat*

properties.name: chat_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format `@supergroupusername`)

objects.name: BotCommandScopeChatAdministrators
objects.description: Represents the [scope](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#botcommandscope) of bot commands, covering all administrators of a specific group or supergroup chat.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Scope type, must be *chat\_administrators*

properties.name: chat_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format `@supergroupusername`)

objects.name: BotCommandScopeChatMember
objects.description: Represents the [scope](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#botcommandscope) of bot commands, covering a specific member of a group or supergroup chat.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Scope type, must be *chat\_member*

properties.name: chat_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format `@supergroupusername`)

properties.name: user_id
properties.description: Unique identifier of the target user

objects.name: BotName
objects.description: This object represents the bot's name.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The bot's name

objects.name: BotDescription
objects.description: This object represents the bot's description.

properties.name: description
properties.description: The bot's description

objects.name: BotShortDescription
objects.description: This object represents the bot's short description.

properties.name: short_description
properties.description: The bot's short description

objects.name: MenuButton
objects.description:
This object describes the bot's menu button in a private chat. It should be one of

* [MenuButtonCommands](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#menubuttoncommands)
* [MenuButtonWebApp](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#menubuttonwebapp)
* [MenuButtonDefault](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#menubuttondefault)

objects.name: MenuButtonCommands
objects.description: Represents a menu button, which opens the bot's list of commands.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the button, must be *commands*

objects.name: MenuButtonWebApp
objects.description: Represents a menu button, which launches a [Web App](https://core.telegram.org/bots/webapps).

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the button, must be *web\_app*

properties.name: text
properties.description: Text on the button

properties.name: web_app
properties.description: Description of the Web App that will be launched when the user presses the button. The Web App will be able to send an arbitrary message on behalf of the user using the method [answerWebAppQuery](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#answerwebappquery). Alternatively, a `t.me` link to a Web App of the bot can be specified in the object instead of the Web App's URL, in which case the Web App will be opened as if the user pressed the link.

objects.name: MenuButtonDefault
objects.description: Describes that no specific value for the menu button was set.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the button, must be *default*

objects.name: ChatBoostSource
objects.description:
This object describes the source of a chat boost. It can be one of

* [ChatBoostSourcePremium](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#chatboostsourcepremium)
* [ChatBoostSourceGiftCode](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#chatboostsourcegiftcode)
* [ChatBoostSourceGiveaway](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#chatboostsourcegiveaway)

objects.name: ChatBoostSourcePremium
objects.description: The boost was obtained by subscribing to Telegram Premium or by gifting a Telegram Premium subscription to another user.

properties.name: source
properties.description: Source of the boost, always “premium”

properties.name: user
properties.description: User that boosted the chat

objects.name: ChatBoostSourceGiftCode
objects.description: The boost was obtained by the creation of Telegram Premium gift codes to boost a chat. Each such code boosts the chat 4 times for the duration of the corresponding Telegram Premium subscription.

properties.name: source
properties.description: Source of the boost, always “gift\_code”

properties.name: user
properties.description: User for which the gift code was created

objects.name: ChatBoostSourceGiveaway
objects.description: The boost was obtained by the creation of a Telegram Premium or a Telegram Star giveaway. This boosts the chat 4 times for the duration of the corresponding Telegram Premium subscription for Telegram Premium giveaways and *prize\_star\_count* / 500 times for one year for Telegram Star giveaways.

properties.name: source
properties.description: Source of the boost, always “giveaway”

properties.name: giveaway_message_id
properties.description: Identifier of a message in the chat with the giveaway; the message could have been deleted already. May be 0 if the message isn't sent yet.

properties.name: user
properties.description: *Optional*. User that won the prize in the giveaway if any; for Telegram Premium giveaways only

properties.name: prize_star_count
properties.description: *Optional*. The number of Telegram Stars to be split between giveaway winners; for Telegram Star giveaways only

properties.name: is_unclaimed
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the giveaway was completed, but there was no user to win the prize

objects.name: ChatBoost
objects.description: This object contains information about a chat boost.

properties.name: boost_id
properties.description: Unique identifier of the boost

properties.name: add_date
properties.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the chat was boosted

properties.name: expiration_date
properties.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the boost will automatically expire, unless the booster's Telegram Premium subscription is prolonged

properties.name: source
properties.description: Source of the added boost

objects.name: ChatBoostUpdated
objects.description: This object represents a boost added to a chat or changed.

properties.name: chat
properties.description: Chat which was boosted

properties.name: boost
properties.description: Information about the chat boost

objects.name: ChatBoostRemoved
objects.description: This object represents a boost removed from a chat.

properties.name: chat
properties.description: Chat which was boosted

properties.name: boost_id
properties.description: Unique identifier of the boost

properties.name: remove_date
properties.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the boost was removed

properties.name: source
properties.description: Source of the removed boost

objects.name: UserChatBoosts
objects.description: This object represents a list of boosts added to a chat by a user.

properties.name: boosts
properties.description: The list of boosts added to the chat by the user

objects.name: BusinessBotRights
objects.description: Represents the rights of a business bot.

properties.name: can_reply
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the bot can send and edit messages in the private chats that had incoming messages in the last 24 hours

properties.name: can_read_messages
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the bot can mark incoming private messages as read

properties.name: can_delete_sent_messages
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the bot can delete messages sent by the bot

properties.name: can_delete_all_messages
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the bot can delete all private messages in managed chats

properties.name: can_edit_name
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the bot can edit the first and last name of the business account

properties.name: can_edit_bio
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the bot can edit the bio of the business account

properties.name: can_edit_profile_photo
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the bot can edit the profile photo of the business account

properties.name: can_edit_username
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the bot can edit the username of the business account

properties.name: can_change_gift_settings
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the bot can change the privacy settings pertaining to gifts for the business account

properties.name: can_view_gifts_and_stars
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the bot can view gifts and the amount of Telegram Stars owned by the business account

properties.name: can_convert_gifts_to_stars
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the bot can convert regular gifts owned by the business account to Telegram Stars

properties.name: can_transfer_and_upgrade_gifts
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the bot can transfer and upgrade gifts owned by the business account

properties.name: can_transfer_stars
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the bot can transfer Telegram Stars received by the business account to its own account, or use them to upgrade and transfer gifts

properties.name: can_manage_stories
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the bot can post, edit and delete stories on behalf of the business account

objects.name: BusinessConnection
objects.description: Describes the connection of the bot with a business account.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier of the business connection

properties.name: user
properties.description: Business account user that created the business connection

properties.name: user_chat_id
properties.description: Identifier of a private chat with the user who created the business connection. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

properties.name: date
properties.description: Date the connection was established in Unix time

properties.name: rights
properties.description: *Optional*. Rights of the business bot

properties.name: is_enabled
properties.description: *True*, if the connection is active

objects.name: BusinessMessagesDeleted
objects.description: This object is received when messages are deleted from a connected business account.

properties.name: business_connection_id
properties.description: Unique identifier of the business connection

properties.name: chat
properties.description: Information about a chat in the business account. The bot may not have access to the chat or the corresponding user.

properties.name: message_ids
properties.description: The list of identifiers of deleted messages in the chat of the business account

objects.name: ResponseParameters
objects.description: Describes why a request was unsuccessful.

properties.name: migrate_to_chat_id
properties.description: *Optional*. The group has been migrated to a supergroup with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.

properties.name: retry_after
properties.description: *Optional*. In case of exceeding flood control, the number of seconds left to wait before the request can be repeated

objects.name: InputMedia
objects.description:
This object represents the content of a media message to be sent. It should be one of

* [InputMediaAnimation](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inputmediaanimation)
* [InputMediaDocument](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inputmediadocument)
* [InputMediaAudio](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inputmediaaudio)
* [InputMediaPhoto](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inputmediaphoto)
* [InputMediaVideo](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inputmediavideo)

objects.name: InputMediaPhoto
objects.description: Represents a photo to be sent.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the result, must be *photo*

properties.name: media
properties.description: File to send. Pass a file\_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass “attach://\<file\_attach\_name\>” to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under \<file\_attach\_name\> name. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#sending-files)

properties.name: caption
properties.description: *Optional*. Caption of the photo to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

properties.name: parse_mode
properties.description: *Optional*. Mode for parsing entities in the photo caption. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#formatting-options) for more details.

properties.name: caption_entities
properties.description: *Optional*. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of *parse\_mode*

properties.name: show_caption_above_media
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True*, if the caption must be shown above the message media

properties.name: has_spoiler
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* if the photo needs to be covered with a spoiler animation

objects.name: InputMediaVideo
objects.description: Represents a video to be sent.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the result, must be *video*

properties.name: media
properties.description: File to send. Pass a file\_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass “attach://\<file\_attach\_name\>” to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under \<file\_attach\_name\> name. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#sending-files)

properties.name: thumbnail
properties.description: *Optional*. Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass “attach://\<file\_attach\_name\>” if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under \<file\_attach\_name\>. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#sending-files)

properties.name: cover
properties.description: *Optional*. Cover for the video in the message. Pass a file\_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass “attach://\<file\_attach\_name\>” to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under \<file\_attach\_name\> name. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#sending-files)

properties.name: start_timestamp
properties.description: *Optional*. Start timestamp for the video in the message

properties.name: caption
properties.description: *Optional*. Caption of the video to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

properties.name: parse_mode
properties.description: *Optional*. Mode for parsing entities in the video caption. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#formatting-options) for more details.

properties.name: caption_entities
properties.description: *Optional*. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of *parse\_mode*

properties.name: show_caption_above_media
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True*, if the caption must be shown above the message media

properties.name: width
properties.description: *Optional*. Video width

properties.name: height
properties.description: *Optional*. Video height

properties.name: duration
properties.description: *Optional*. Video duration in seconds

properties.name: supports_streaming
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* if the uploaded video is suitable for streaming

properties.name: has_spoiler
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* if the video needs to be covered with a spoiler animation

objects.name: InputMediaAnimation
objects.description: Represents an animation file (GIF or H.264/MPEG-4 AVC video without sound) to be sent.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the result, must be *animation*

properties.name: media
properties.description: File to send. Pass a file\_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass “attach://\<file\_attach\_name\>” to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under \<file\_attach\_name\> name. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#sending-files)

properties.name: thumbnail
properties.description: *Optional*. Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass “attach://\<file\_attach\_name\>” if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under \<file\_attach\_name\>. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#sending-files)

properties.name: caption
properties.description: *Optional*. Caption of the animation to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

properties.name: parse_mode
properties.description: *Optional*. Mode for parsing entities in the animation caption. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#formatting-options) for more details.

properties.name: caption_entities
properties.description: *Optional*. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of *parse\_mode*

properties.name: show_caption_above_media
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True*, if the caption must be shown above the message media

properties.name: width
properties.description: *Optional*. Animation width

properties.name: height
properties.description: *Optional*. Animation height

properties.name: duration
properties.description: *Optional*. Animation duration in seconds

properties.name: has_spoiler
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* if the animation needs to be covered with a spoiler animation

objects.name: InputMediaAudio
objects.description: Represents an audio file to be treated as music to be sent.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the result, must be *audio*

properties.name: media
properties.description: File to send. Pass a file\_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass “attach://\<file\_attach\_name\>” to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under \<file\_attach\_name\> name. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#sending-files)

properties.name: thumbnail
properties.description: *Optional*. Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass “attach://\<file\_attach\_name\>” if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under \<file\_attach\_name\>. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#sending-files)

properties.name: caption
properties.description: *Optional*. Caption of the audio to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

properties.name: parse_mode
properties.description: *Optional*. Mode for parsing entities in the audio caption. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#formatting-options) for more details.

properties.name: caption_entities
properties.description: *Optional*. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of *parse\_mode*

properties.name: duration
properties.description: *Optional*. Duration of the audio in seconds

properties.name: performer
properties.description: *Optional*. Performer of the audio

properties.name: title
properties.description: *Optional*. Title of the audio

objects.name: InputMediaDocument
objects.description: Represents a general file to be sent.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the result, must be *document*

properties.name: media
properties.description: File to send. Pass a file\_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass “attach://\<file\_attach\_name\>” to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under \<file\_attach\_name\> name. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#sending-files)

properties.name: thumbnail
properties.description: *Optional*. Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass “attach://\<file\_attach\_name\>” if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under \<file\_attach\_name\>. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#sending-files)

properties.name: caption
properties.description: *Optional*. Caption of the document to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

properties.name: parse_mode
properties.description: *Optional*. Mode for parsing entities in the document caption. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#formatting-options) for more details.

properties.name: caption_entities
properties.description: *Optional*. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of *parse\_mode*

properties.name: disable_content_type_detection
properties.description: *Optional*. Disables automatic server-side content type detection for files uploaded using multipart/form-data. Always *True*, if the document is sent as part of an album.

objects.name: InputFile
objects.description: This object represents the contents of a file to be uploaded. Must be posted using multipart/form-data in the usual way that files are uploaded via the browser.

objects.name: InputPaidMedia
objects.description:
This object describes the paid media to be sent. Currently, it can be one of

* [InputPaidMediaPhoto](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inputpaidmediaphoto)
* [InputPaidMediaVideo](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inputpaidmediavideo)

objects.name: InputPaidMediaPhoto
objects.description: The paid media to send is a photo.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the media, must be *photo*

properties.name: media
properties.description: File to send. Pass a file\_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass “attach://\<file\_attach\_name\>” to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under \<file\_attach\_name\> name. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#sending-files)

objects.name: InputPaidMediaVideo
objects.description: The paid media to send is a video.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the media, must be *video*

properties.name: media
properties.description: File to send. Pass a file\_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass “attach://\<file\_attach\_name\>” to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under \<file\_attach\_name\> name. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#sending-files)

properties.name: thumbnail
properties.description: *Optional*. Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass “attach://\<file\_attach\_name\>” if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under \<file\_attach\_name\>. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#sending-files)

properties.name: cover
properties.description: *Optional*. Cover for the video in the message. Pass a file\_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass “attach://\<file\_attach\_name\>” to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under \<file\_attach\_name\> name. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#sending-files)

properties.name: start_timestamp
properties.description: *Optional*. Start timestamp for the video in the message

properties.name: width
properties.description: *Optional*. Video width

properties.name: height
properties.description: *Optional*. Video height

properties.name: duration
properties.description: *Optional*. Video duration in seconds

properties.name: supports_streaming
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* if the uploaded video is suitable for streaming

objects.name: InputProfilePhoto
objects.description:
This object describes a profile photo to set. Currently, it can be one of

* [InputProfilePhotoStatic](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inputprofilephotostatic)
* [InputProfilePhotoAnimated](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inputprofilephotoanimated)

objects.name: InputProfilePhotoStatic
objects.description: A static profile photo in the .JPG format.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the profile photo, must be *static*

properties.name: photo
properties.description: The static profile photo. Profile photos can't be reused and can only be uploaded as a new file, so you can pass “attach://\<file\_attach\_name\>” if the photo was uploaded using multipart/form-data under \<file\_attach\_name\>. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#sending-files)

objects.name: InputProfilePhotoAnimated
objects.description: An animated profile photo in the MPEG4 format.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the profile photo, must be *animated*

properties.name: animation
properties.description: The animated profile photo. Profile photos can't be reused and can only be uploaded as a new file, so you can pass “attach://\<file\_attach\_name\>” if the photo was uploaded using multipart/form-data under \<file\_attach\_name\>. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#sending-files)

properties.name: main_frame_timestamp
properties.description: *Optional*. Timestamp in seconds of the frame that will be used as the static profile photo. Defaults to 0.0.

objects.name: InputStoryContent
objects.description:
This object describes the content of a story to post. Currently, it can be one of

* [InputStoryContentPhoto](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inputstorycontentphoto)
* [InputStoryContentVideo](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inputstorycontentvideo)

objects.name: InputStoryContentPhoto
objects.description: Describes a photo to post as a story.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the content, must be *photo*

properties.name: photo
properties.description: The photo to post as a story. The photo must be of the size 1080x1920 and must not exceed 10 MB. The photo can't be reused and can only be uploaded as a new file, so you can pass “attach://\<file\_attach\_name\>” if the photo was uploaded using multipart/form-data under \<file\_attach\_name\>. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#sending-files)

objects.name: InputStoryContentVideo
objects.description: Describes a video to post as a story.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the content, must be *video*

properties.name: video
properties.description: The video to post as a story. The video must be of the size 720x1280, streamable, encoded with H.265 codec, with key frames added each second in the MPEG4 format, and must not exceed 30 MB. The video can't be reused and can only be uploaded as a new file, so you can pass “attach://\<file\_attach\_name\>” if the video was uploaded using multipart/form-data under \<file\_attach\_name\>. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#sending-files)

properties.name: duration
properties.description: *Optional*. Precise duration of the video in seconds; 0-60

properties.name: cover_frame_timestamp
properties.description: *Optional*. Timestamp in seconds of the frame that will be used as the static cover for the story. Defaults to 0.0.

properties.name: is_animation
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* if the video has no sound

objects.name: Sticker
objects.description: This object represents a sticker.

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the sticker, currently one of “regular”, “mask”, “custom\_emoji”. The type of the sticker is independent from its format, which is determined by the fields *is\_animated* and *is\_video*.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Sticker width

properties.name: height
properties.description: Sticker height

properties.name: is_animated
properties.description: *True*, if the sticker is [animated](https://telegram.org/blog/animated-stickers)

properties.name: is_video
properties.description: *True*, if the sticker is a [video sticker](https://telegram.org/blog/video-stickers-better-reactions)

properties.name: thumbnail
properties.description: *Optional*. Sticker thumbnail in the .WEBP or .JPG format

properties.name: emoji
properties.description: *Optional*. Emoji associated with the sticker

properties.name: set_name
properties.description: *Optional*. Name of the sticker set to which the sticker belongs

properties.name: premium_animation
properties.description: *Optional*. For premium regular stickers, premium animation for the sticker

properties.name: mask_position
properties.description: *Optional*. For mask stickers, the position where the mask should be placed

properties.name: custom_emoji_id
properties.description: *Optional*. For custom emoji stickers, unique identifier of the custom emoji

properties.name: needs_repainting
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the sticker must be repainted to a text color in messages, the color of the Telegram Premium badge in emoji status, white color on chat photos, or another appropriate color in other places

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: *Optional*. File size in bytes

objects.name: StickerSet
objects.description: This object represents a sticker set.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Sticker set name

properties.name: title
properties.description: Sticker set title

properties.name: sticker_type
properties.description: Type of stickers in the set, currently one of “regular”, “mask”, “custom\_emoji”

properties.name: stickers
properties.description: List of all set stickers

properties.name: thumbnail
properties.description: *Optional*. Sticker set thumbnail in the .WEBP, .TGS, or .WEBM format

objects.name: MaskPosition
objects.description: This object describes the position on faces where a mask should be placed by default.

properties.name: point
properties.description: The part of the face relative to which the mask should be placed. One of “forehead”, “eyes”, “mouth”, or “chin”.

properties.name: x_shift
properties.description: Shift by X-axis measured in widths of the mask scaled to the face size, from left to right. For example, choosing -1.0 will place mask just to the left of the default mask position.

properties.name: y_shift
properties.description: Shift by Y-axis measured in heights of the mask scaled to the face size, from top to bottom. For example, 1.0 will place the mask just below the default mask position.

properties.name: scale
properties.description: Mask scaling coefficient. For example, 2.0 means double size.

objects.name: InputSticker
objects.description: This object describes a sticker to be added to a sticker set.

properties.name: sticker
properties.description: The added sticker. Pass a *file\_id* as a String to send a file that already exists on the Telegram servers, pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass “attach://\<file\_attach\_name\>” to upload a new file using multipart/form-data under \<file\_attach\_name\> name. Animated and video stickers can't be uploaded via HTTP URL. [More information on Sending Files »](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#sending-files)

properties.name: format
properties.description: Format of the added sticker, must be one of “static” for a **.WEBP** or **.PNG** image, “animated” for a **.TGS** animation, “video” for a **.WEBM** video

properties.name: emoji_list
properties.description: List of 1-20 emoji associated with the sticker

properties.name: mask_position
properties.description: *Optional*. Position where the mask should be placed on faces. For “mask” stickers only.

properties.name: keywords
properties.description: *Optional*. List of 0-20 search keywords for the sticker with total length of up to 64 characters. For “regular” and “custom\_emoji” stickers only.

objects.name: InlineQuery
objects.description: This object represents an incoming inline query. When the user sends an empty query, your bot could return some default or trending results.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this query

properties.name: from
properties.description: Sender

properties.name: query
properties.description: Text of the query (up to 256 characters)

properties.name: offset
properties.description: Offset of the results to be returned, can be controlled by the bot

properties.name: chat_type
properties.description: *Optional*. Type of the chat from which the inline query was sent. Can be either “sender” for a private chat with the inline query sender, “private”, “group”, “supergroup”, or “channel”. The chat type should be always known for requests sent from official clients and most third-party clients, unless the request was sent from a secret chat

properties.name: location
properties.description: *Optional*. Sender location, only for bots that request user location

objects.name: InlineQueryResultsButton
objects.description: This object represents a button to be shown above inline query results. You **must** use exactly one of the optional fields.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Label text on the button

properties.name: web_app
properties.description: *Optional*. Description of the [Web App](https://core.telegram.org/bots/webapps) that will be launched when the user presses the button. The Web App will be able to switch back to the inline mode using the method [switchInlineQuery](https://core.telegram.org/bots/webapps#initializing-mini-apps) inside the Web App.

properties.name: start_parameter
properties.description:
*Optional*. [Deep-linking](https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#deep-linking) parameter for the /start message sent to the bot when a user presses the button. 1-64 characters, only `A-Z`, `a-z`, `0-9`, `_` and `-` are allowed.  

*Example:* An inline bot that sends YouTube videos can ask the user to connect the bot to their YouTube account to adapt search results accordingly. To do this, it displays a 'Connect your YouTube account' button above the results, or even before showing any. The user presses the button, switches to a private chat with the bot and, in doing so, passes a start parameter that instructs the bot to return an OAuth link. Once done, the bot can offer a [*switch\_inline*](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inlinekeyboardmarkup) button so that the user can easily return to the chat where they wanted to use the bot's inline capabilities.

objects.name: InlineQueryResult
objects.description:
This object represents one result of an inline query. Telegram clients currently support results of the following 20 types:

* [InlineQueryResultCachedAudio](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inlinequeryresultcachedaudio)
* [InlineQueryResultCachedDocument](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inlinequeryresultcacheddocument)
* [InlineQueryResultCachedGif](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inlinequeryresultcachedgif)
* [InlineQueryResultCachedMpeg4Gif](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inlinequeryresultcachedmpeg4gif)
* [InlineQueryResultCachedPhoto](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inlinequeryresultcachedphoto)
* [InlineQueryResultCachedSticker](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inlinequeryresultcachedsticker)
* [InlineQueryResultCachedVideo](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inlinequeryresultcachedvideo)
* [InlineQueryResultCachedVoice](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inlinequeryresultcachedvoice)
* [InlineQueryResultArticle](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inlinequeryresultarticle)
* [InlineQueryResultAudio](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inlinequeryresultaudio)
* [InlineQueryResultContact](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inlinequeryresultcontact)
* [InlineQueryResultGame](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inlinequeryresultgame)
* [InlineQueryResultDocument](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inlinequeryresultdocument)
* [InlineQueryResultGif](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inlinequeryresultgif)
* [InlineQueryResultLocation](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inlinequeryresultlocation)
* [InlineQueryResultMpeg4Gif](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inlinequeryresultmpeg4gif)
* [InlineQueryResultPhoto](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inlinequeryresultphoto)
* [InlineQueryResultVenue](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inlinequeryresultvenue)
* [InlineQueryResultVideo](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inlinequeryresultvideo)
* [InlineQueryResultVoice](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inlinequeryresultvoice)

properties.name: url
properties.description: *Optional*. URL of the result

objects.name: InlineQueryResultPhoto
objects.description: Represents a link to a photo. By default, this photo will be sent by the user with optional caption. Alternatively, you can use *input\_message\_content* to send a message with the specified content instead of the photo.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the result, must be *photo*

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

properties.name: photo_url
properties.description: A valid URL of the photo. Photo must be in **JPEG** format. Photo size must not exceed 5MB

properties.name: thumbnail_url
properties.description: URL of the thumbnail for the photo

properties.name: photo_width
properties.description: *Optional*. Width of the photo

properties.name: photo_height
properties.description: *Optional*. Height of the photo

properties.name: title
properties.description: *Optional*. Title for the result

properties.name: description
properties.description: *Optional*. Short description of the result

properties.name: caption
properties.description: *Optional*. Caption of the photo to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

properties.name: parse_mode
properties.description: *Optional*. Mode for parsing entities in the photo caption. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#formatting-options) for more details.

properties.name: caption_entities
properties.description: *Optional*. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of *parse\_mode*

properties.name: show_caption_above_media
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True*, if the caption must be shown above the message media

properties.name: reply_markup
properties.description: *Optional*. [Inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards) attached to the message

properties.name: input_message_content
properties.description: *Optional*. Content of the message to be sent instead of the photo

objects.name: InlineQueryResultVideo
objects.description:
Represents a link to a page containing an embedded video player or a video file. By default, this video file will be sent by the user with an optional caption. Alternatively, you can use *input\_message\_content* to send a message with the specified content instead of the video.

If an InlineQueryResultVideo message contains an embedded video (e.g., YouTube), you **must** replace its content using *input\_message\_content*.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the result, must be *video*

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

properties.name: video_url
properties.description: A valid URL for the embedded video player or video file

properties.name: mime_type
properties.description: MIME type of the content of the video URL, “text/html” or “video/mp4”

properties.name: thumbnail_url
properties.description: URL of the thumbnail (JPEG only) for the video

properties.name: title
properties.description: Title for the result

properties.name: caption
properties.description: *Optional*. Caption of the video to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

properties.name: parse_mode
properties.description: *Optional*. Mode for parsing entities in the video caption. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#formatting-options) for more details.

properties.name: caption_entities
properties.description: *Optional*. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of *parse\_mode*

properties.name: show_caption_above_media
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True*, if the caption must be shown above the message media

properties.name: video_width
properties.description: *Optional*. Video width

properties.name: video_height
properties.description: *Optional*. Video height

properties.name: video_duration
properties.description: *Optional*. Video duration in seconds

properties.name: description
properties.description: *Optional*. Short description of the result

properties.name: reply_markup
properties.description: *Optional*. [Inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards) attached to the message

properties.name: input_message_content
properties.description: *Optional*. Content of the message to be sent instead of the video. This field is **required** if InlineQueryResultVideo is used to send an HTML-page as a result (e.g., a YouTube video).
