properties.description: *Optional*. Content of the message to be sent instead of the video animation

objects.name: InlineQueryResultCachedSticker
objects.description: Represents a link to a sticker stored on the Telegram servers. By default, this sticker will be sent by the user. Alternatively, you can use *input\_message\_content* to send a message with the specified content instead of the sticker.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the result, must be *sticker*

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

properties.name: sticker_file_id
properties.description: A valid file identifier of the sticker

properties.name: reply_markup
properties.description: *Optional*. [Inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards) attached to the message

properties.name: input_message_content
properties.description: *Optional*. Content of the message to be sent instead of the sticker

objects.name: InlineQueryResultCachedDocument
objects.description: Represents a link to a file stored on the Telegram servers. By default, this file will be sent by the user with an optional caption. Alternatively, you can use *input\_message\_content* to send a message with the specified content instead of the file.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the result, must be *document*

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

properties.name: title
properties.description: Title for the result

properties.name: document_file_id
properties.description: A valid file identifier for the file

properties.name: description
properties.description: *Optional*. Short description of the result

properties.name: caption
properties.description: *Optional*. Caption of the document to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

properties.name: parse_mode
properties.description: *Optional*. Mode for parsing entities in the document caption. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#formatting-options) for more details.

properties.name: caption_entities
properties.description: *Optional*. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of *parse\_mode*

properties.name: reply_markup
properties.description: *Optional*. [Inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards) attached to the message

properties.name: input_message_content
properties.description: *Optional*. Content of the message to be sent instead of the file

objects.name: InlineQueryResultCachedVideo
objects.description: Represents a link to a video file stored on the Telegram servers. By default, this video file will be sent by the user with an optional caption. Alternatively, you can use *input\_message\_content* to send a message with the specified content instead of the video.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the result, must be *video*

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

properties.name: video_file_id
properties.description: A valid file identifier for the video file

properties.name: title
properties.description: Title for the result

properties.name: description
properties.description: *Optional*. Short description of the result

properties.name: caption
properties.description: *Optional*. Caption of the video to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

properties.name: parse_mode
properties.description: *Optional*. Mode for parsing entities in the video caption. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#formatting-options) for more details.

properties.name: caption_entities
properties.description: *Optional*. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of *parse\_mode*

properties.name: show_caption_above_media
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True*, if the caption must be shown above the message media

properties.name: reply_markup
properties.description: *Optional*. [Inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards) attached to the message

properties.name: input_message_content
properties.description: *Optional*. Content of the message to be sent instead of the video

objects.name: InlineQueryResultCachedVoice
objects.description: Represents a link to a voice message stored on the Telegram servers. By default, this voice message will be sent by the user. Alternatively, you can use *input\_message\_content* to send a message with the specified content instead of the voice message.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the result, must be *voice*

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

properties.name: voice_file_id
properties.description: A valid file identifier for the voice message

properties.name: title
properties.description: Voice message title

properties.name: caption
properties.description: *Optional*. Caption, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

properties.name: parse_mode
properties.description: *Optional*. Mode for parsing entities in the voice message caption. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#formatting-options) for more details.

properties.name: caption_entities
properties.description: *Optional*. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of *parse\_mode*

properties.name: reply_markup
properties.description: *Optional*. [Inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards) attached to the message

properties.name: input_message_content
properties.description: *Optional*. Content of the message to be sent instead of the voice message

objects.name: InlineQueryResultCachedAudio
objects.description: Represents a link to an MP3 audio file stored on the Telegram servers. By default, this audio file will be sent by the user. Alternatively, you can use *input\_message\_content* to send a message with the specified content instead of the audio.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the result, must be *audio*

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes

properties.name: audio_file_id
properties.description: A valid file identifier for the audio file

properties.name: caption
properties.description: *Optional*. Caption, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing

properties.name: parse_mode
properties.description: *Optional*. Mode for parsing entities in the audio caption. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#formatting-options) for more details.

properties.name: caption_entities
properties.description: *Optional*. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of *parse\_mode*

properties.name: reply_markup
properties.description: *Optional*. [Inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/bots/features#inline-keyboards) attached to the message

properties.name: input_message_content
properties.description: *Optional*. Content of the message to be sent instead of the audio

objects.name: InputMessageContent
objects.description:
This object represents the content of a message to be sent as a result of an inline query. Telegram clients currently support the following 5 types:

* [InputTextMessageContent](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inputtextmessagecontent)
* [InputLocationMessageContent](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inputlocationmessagecontent)
* [InputVenueMessageContent](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inputvenuemessagecontent)
* [InputContactMessageContent](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inputcontactmessagecontent)
* [InputInvoiceMessageContent](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inputinvoicemessagecontent)

objects.name: InputTextMessageContent
objects.description: Represents the [content](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inputmessagecontent) of a text message to be sent as the result of an inline query.

properties.name: message_text
properties.description: Text of the message to be sent, 1-4096 characters

properties.name: parse_mode
properties.description: *Optional*. Mode for parsing entities in the message text. See [formatting options](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#formatting-options) for more details.

properties.name: entities
properties.description: *Optional*. List of special entities that appear in message text, which can be specified instead of *parse\_mode*

properties.name: link_preview_options
properties.description: *Optional*. Link preview generation options for the message

objects.name: InputLocationMessageContent
objects.description: Represents the [content](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inputmessagecontent) of a location message to be sent as the result of an inline query.

properties.name: latitude
properties.description: Latitude of the location in degrees

properties.name: longitude
properties.description: Longitude of the location in degrees

properties.name: horizontal_accuracy
properties.description: *Optional*. The radius of uncertainty for the location, measured in meters; 0-1500

properties.name: live_period
properties.description: *Optional*. Period in seconds during which the location can be updated, should be between 60 and 86400, or 0x7FFFFFFF for live locations that can be edited indefinitely.

properties.name: heading
properties.description: *Optional*. For live locations, a direction in which the user is moving, in degrees. Must be between 1 and 360 if specified.

properties.name: proximity_alert_radius
properties.description: *Optional*. For live locations, a maximum distance for proximity alerts about approaching another chat member, in meters. Must be between 1 and 100000 if specified.

objects.name: InputVenueMessageContent
objects.description: Represents the [content](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inputmessagecontent) of a venue message to be sent as the result of an inline query.

properties.name: latitude
properties.description: Latitude of the venue in degrees

properties.name: longitude
properties.description: Longitude of the venue in degrees

properties.name: title
properties.description: Name of the venue

properties.name: address
properties.description: Address of the venue

properties.name: foursquare_id
properties.description: *Optional*. Foursquare identifier of the venue, if known

properties.name: foursquare_type
properties.description: *Optional*. Foursquare type of the venue, if known. (For example, “arts\_entertainment/default”, “arts\_entertainment/aquarium” or “food/icecream”.)

properties.name: google_place_id
properties.description: *Optional*. Google Places identifier of the venue

properties.name: google_place_type
properties.description: *Optional*. Google Places type of the venue. (See [supported types](https://developers.google.com/places/web-service/supported_types).)

objects.name: InputContactMessageContent
objects.description: Represents the [content](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inputmessagecontent) of a contact message to be sent as the result of an inline query.

properties.name: phone_number
properties.description: Contact's phone number

properties.name: first_name
properties.description: Contact's first name

properties.name: last_name
properties.description: *Optional*. Contact's last name

properties.name: vcard
properties.description: *Optional*. Additional data about the contact in the form of a [vCard](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/VCard), 0-2048 bytes

objects.name: InputInvoiceMessageContent
objects.description: Represents the [content](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inputmessagecontent) of an invoice message to be sent as the result of an inline query.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Product name, 1-32 characters

properties.name: description
properties.description: Product description, 1-255 characters

properties.name: payload
properties.description: Bot-defined invoice payload, 1-128 bytes. This will not be displayed to the user, use it for your internal processes.

properties.name: provider_token
properties.description: *Optional*. Payment provider token, obtained via [@BotFather](https://t.me/botfather). Pass an empty string for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90).

properties.name: currency
properties.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code, see [more on currencies](https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments#supported-currencies). Pass “XTR” for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90).

properties.name: prices
properties.description: Price breakdown, a JSON-serialized list of components (e.g. product price, tax, discount, delivery cost, delivery tax, bonus, etc.). Must contain exactly one item for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90).

properties.name: max_tip_amount
properties.description: *Optional*. The maximum accepted amount for tips in the *smallest units* of the currency (integer, **not** float/double). For example, for a maximum tip of `US$ 1.45` pass `max_tip_amount = 145`. See the *exp* parameter in [currencies.json](https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments/currencies.json), it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies). Defaults to 0. Not supported for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90).

properties.name: suggested_tip_amounts
properties.description: *Optional*. A JSON-serialized array of suggested amounts of tip in the *smallest units* of the currency (integer, **not** float/double). At most 4 suggested tip amounts can be specified. The suggested tip amounts must be positive, passed in a strictly increased order and must not exceed *max\_tip\_amount*.

properties.name: provider_data
properties.description: *Optional*. A JSON-serialized object for data about the invoice, which will be shared with the payment provider. A detailed description of the required fields should be provided by the payment provider.

properties.name: photo_url
properties.description: *Optional*. URL of the product photo for the invoice. Can be a photo of the goods or a marketing image for a service.

properties.name: photo_size
properties.description: *Optional*. Photo size in bytes

properties.name: photo_width
properties.description: *Optional*. Photo width

properties.name: photo_height
properties.description: *Optional*. Photo height

properties.name: need_name
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* if you require the user's full name to complete the order. Ignored for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90).

properties.name: need_phone_number
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* if you require the user's phone number to complete the order. Ignored for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90).

properties.name: need_email
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* if you require the user's email address to complete the order. Ignored for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90).

properties.name: need_shipping_address
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* if you require the user's shipping address to complete the order. Ignored for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90).

properties.name: send_phone_number_to_provider
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* if the user's phone number should be sent to the provider. Ignored for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90).

properties.name: send_email_to_provider
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* if the user's email address should be sent to the provider. Ignored for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90).

properties.name: is_flexible
properties.description: *Optional*. Pass *True* if the final price depends on the shipping method. Ignored for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90).

objects.name: ChosenInlineResult
objects.description: Represents a [result](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inlinequeryresult) of an inline query that was chosen by the user and sent to their chat partner.

properties.name: result_id
properties.description: The unique identifier for the result that was chosen

properties.name: from
properties.description: The user that chose the result

properties.name: location
properties.description: *Optional*. Sender location, only for bots that require user location

properties.name: inline_message_id
properties.description: *Optional*. Identifier of the sent inline message. Available only if there is an [inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inlinekeyboardmarkup) attached to the message. Will be also received in [callback queries](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#callbackquery) and can be used to [edit](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#updating-messages) the message.

properties.name: query
properties.description: The query that was used to obtain the result

objects.name: SentWebAppMessage
objects.description: Describes an inline message sent by a [Web App](https://core.telegram.org/bots/webapps) on behalf of a user.

properties.name: inline_message_id
properties.description: *Optional*. Identifier of the sent inline message. Available only if there is an [inline keyboard](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#inlinekeyboardmarkup) attached to the message.

objects.name: PreparedInlineMessage
objects.description: Describes an inline message to be sent by a user of a Mini App.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier of the prepared message

properties.name: expiration_date
properties.description: Expiration date of the prepared message, in Unix time. Expired prepared messages can no longer be used

objects.name: LabeledPrice
objects.description: This object represents a portion of the price for goods or services.

properties.name: label
properties.description: Portion label

properties.name: amount
properties.description: Price of the product in the *smallest units* of the [currency](https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments#supported-currencies) (integer, **not** float/double). For example, for a price of `US$ 1.45` pass `amount = 145`. See the *exp* parameter in [currencies.json](https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments/currencies.json), it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies).

objects.name: Invoice
objects.description: This object contains basic information about an invoice.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Product name

properties.name: description
properties.description: Product description

properties.name: start_parameter
properties.description: Unique bot deep-linking parameter that can be used to generate this invoice

properties.name: currency
properties.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 [currency](https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments#supported-currencies) code, or “XTR” for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90)

properties.name: total_amount
properties.description: Total price in the *smallest units* of the currency (integer, **not** float/double). For example, for a price of `US$ 1.45` pass `amount = 145`. See the *exp* parameter in [currencies.json](https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments/currencies.json), it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies).

objects.name: ShippingAddress
objects.description: This object represents a shipping address.

properties.name: country_code
properties.description: Two-letter [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) country code

properties.name: state
properties.description: State, if applicable

properties.name: city
properties.description: City

properties.name: street_line1
properties.description: First line for the address

properties.name: street_line2
properties.description: Second line for the address

properties.name: post_code
properties.description: Address post code

objects.name: OrderInfo
objects.description: This object represents information about an order.

properties.name: name
properties.description: *Optional*. User name

properties.name: phone_number
properties.description: *Optional*. User's phone number

properties.name: email
properties.description: *Optional*. User email

properties.name: shipping_address
properties.description: *Optional*. User shipping address

objects.name: ShippingOption
objects.description: This object represents one shipping option.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Shipping option identifier

properties.name: title
properties.description: Option title

properties.name: prices
properties.description: List of price portions

objects.name: SuccessfulPayment
objects.description: This object contains basic information about a successful payment. Note that if the buyer initiates a chargeback with the relevant payment provider following this transaction, the funds may be debited from your balance. This is outside of Telegram's control.

properties.name: currency
properties.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 [currency](https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments#supported-currencies) code, or “XTR” for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90)

properties.name: total_amount
properties.description: Total price in the *smallest units* of the currency (integer, **not** float/double). For example, for a price of `US$ 1.45` pass `amount = 145`. See the *exp* parameter in [currencies.json](https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments/currencies.json), it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies).

properties.name: invoice_payload
properties.description: Bot-specified invoice payload

properties.name: subscription_expiration_date
properties.description: *Optional*. Expiration date of the subscription, in Unix time; for recurring payments only

properties.name: is_recurring
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the payment is a recurring payment for a subscription

properties.name: is_first_recurring
properties.description: *Optional*. *True*, if the payment is the first payment for a subscription

properties.name: shipping_option_id
properties.description: *Optional*. Identifier of the shipping option chosen by the user

properties.name: order_info
properties.description: *Optional*. Order information provided by the user

properties.name: telegram_payment_charge_id
properties.description: Telegram payment identifier

properties.name: provider_payment_charge_id
properties.description: Provider payment identifier

objects.name: RefundedPayment
objects.description: This object contains basic information about a refunded payment.

properties.name: currency
properties.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 [currency](https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments#supported-currencies) code, or “XTR” for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90). Currently, always “XTR”

properties.name: total_amount
properties.description: Total refunded price in the *smallest units* of the currency (integer, **not** float/double). For example, for a price of `US$ 1.45`, `total_amount = 145`. See the *exp* parameter in [currencies.json](https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments/currencies.json), it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies).

properties.name: invoice_payload
properties.description: Bot-specified invoice payload

properties.name: telegram_payment_charge_id
properties.description: Telegram payment identifier

properties.name: provider_payment_charge_id
properties.description: *Optional*. Provider payment identifier

objects.name: ShippingQuery
objects.description: This object contains information about an incoming shipping query.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique query identifier

properties.name: from
properties.description: User who sent the query

properties.name: invoice_payload
properties.description: Bot-specified invoice payload

properties.name: shipping_address
properties.description: User specified shipping address

objects.name: PreCheckoutQuery
objects.description: This object contains information about an incoming pre-checkout query.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique query identifier

properties.name: from
properties.description: User who sent the query

properties.name: currency
properties.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 [currency](https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments#supported-currencies) code, or “XTR” for payments in [Telegram Stars](https://t.me/BotNews/90)

properties.name: total_amount
properties.description: Total price in the *smallest units* of the currency (integer, **not** float/double). For example, for a price of `US$ 1.45` pass `amount = 145`. See the *exp* parameter in [currencies.json](https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments/currencies.json), it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies).

properties.name: invoice_payload
properties.description: Bot-specified invoice payload

properties.name: shipping_option_id
properties.description: *Optional*. Identifier of the shipping option chosen by the user

properties.name: order_info
properties.description: *Optional*. Order information provided by the user

objects.name: PaidMediaPurchased
objects.description: This object contains information about a paid media purchase.

properties.name: from
properties.description: User who purchased the media

properties.name: paid_media_payload
properties.description: Bot-specified paid media payload

objects.name: RevenueWithdrawalState
objects.description:
This object describes the state of a revenue withdrawal operation. Currently, it can be one of

* [RevenueWithdrawalStatePending](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#revenuewithdrawalstatepending)
* [RevenueWithdrawalStateSucceeded](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#revenuewithdrawalstatesucceeded)
* [RevenueWithdrawalStateFailed](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#revenuewithdrawalstatefailed)

objects.name: RevenueWithdrawalStatePending
objects.description: The withdrawal is in progress.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the state, always “pending”

objects.name: RevenueWithdrawalStateSucceeded
objects.description: The withdrawal succeeded.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the state, always “succeeded”

properties.name: date
properties.description: Date the withdrawal was completed in Unix time

properties.name: url
properties.description: An HTTPS URL that can be used to see transaction details

objects.name: RevenueWithdrawalStateFailed
objects.description: The withdrawal failed and the transaction was refunded.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the state, always “failed”

objects.name: AffiliateInfo
objects.description: Contains information about the affiliate that received a commission via this transaction.

properties.name: affiliate_user
properties.description: *Optional*. The bot or the user that received an affiliate commission if it was received by a bot or a user

properties.name: affiliate_chat
properties.description: *Optional*. The chat that received an affiliate commission if it was received by a chat

properties.name: commission_per_mille
properties.description: The number of Telegram Stars received by the affiliate for each 1000 Telegram Stars received by the bot from referred users

properties.name: amount
properties.description: Integer amount of Telegram Stars received by the affiliate from the transaction, rounded to 0; can be negative for refunds

properties.name: nanostar_amount
properties.description: *Optional*. The number of 1/1000000000 shares of Telegram Stars received by the affiliate; from -999999999 to 999999999; can be negative for refunds

objects.name: TransactionPartner
objects.description:
This object describes the source of a transaction, or its recipient for outgoing transactions. Currently, it can be one of

* [TransactionPartnerUser](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#transactionpartneruser)
* [TransactionPartnerChat](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#transactionpartnerchat)
* [TransactionPartnerAffiliateProgram](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#transactionpartneraffiliateprogram)
* [TransactionPartnerFragment](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#transactionpartnerfragment)
* [TransactionPartnerTelegramAds](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#transactionpartnertelegramads)
* [TransactionPartnerTelegramApi](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#transactionpartnertelegramapi)
* [TransactionPartnerOther](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#transactionpartnerother)

objects.name: TransactionPartnerUser
objects.description: Describes a transaction with a user.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the transaction partner, always “user”

properties.name: transaction_type
properties.description: Type of the transaction, currently one of “invoice\_payment” for payments via invoices, “paid\_media\_payment” for payments for paid media, “gift\_purchase” for gifts sent by the bot, “premium\_purchase” for Telegram Premium subscriptions gifted by the bot, “business\_account\_transfer” for direct transfers from managed business accounts

properties.name: user
properties.description: Information about the user

properties.name: affiliate
properties.description: *Optional*. Information about the affiliate that received a commission via this transaction. Can be available only for “invoice\_payment” and “paid\_media\_payment” transactions.

properties.name: invoice_payload
properties.description: *Optional*. Bot-specified invoice payload. Can be available only for “invoice\_payment” transactions.

properties.name: subscription_period
properties.description: *Optional*. The duration of the paid subscription. Can be available only for “invoice\_payment” transactions.

properties.name: paid_media
properties.description: *Optional*. Information about the paid media bought by the user; for “paid\_media\_payment” transactions only

properties.name: paid_media_payload
properties.description: *Optional*. Bot-specified paid media payload. Can be available only for “paid\_media\_payment” transactions.

properties.name: gift
properties.description: *Optional*. The gift sent to the user by the bot; for “gift\_purchase” transactions only

properties.name: premium_subscription_duration
properties.description: *Optional*. Number of months the gifted Telegram Premium subscription will be active for; for “premium\_purchase” transactions only

objects.name: TransactionPartnerChat
objects.description: Describes a transaction with a chat.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the transaction partner, always “chat”

properties.name: chat
properties.description: Information about the chat

properties.name: gift
properties.description: *Optional*. The gift sent to the chat by the bot

objects.name: TransactionPartnerAffiliateProgram
objects.description: Describes the affiliate program that issued the affiliate commission received via this transaction.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the transaction partner, always “affiliate\_program”

properties.name: sponsor_user
properties.description: *Optional*. Information about the bot that sponsored the affiliate program

properties.name: commission_per_mille
properties.description: The number of Telegram Stars received by the bot for each 1000 Telegram Stars received by the affiliate program sponsor from referred users

objects.name: TransactionPartnerFragment
objects.description: Describes a withdrawal transaction with Fragment.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the transaction partner, always “fragment”

properties.name: withdrawal_state
properties.description: *Optional*. State of the transaction if the transaction is outgoing

objects.name: TransactionPartnerTelegramAds
objects.description: Describes a withdrawal transaction to the Telegram Ads platform.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the transaction partner, always “telegram\_ads”

objects.name: TransactionPartnerTelegramApi
objects.description: Describes a transaction with payment for [paid broadcasting](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#paid-broadcasts).

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the transaction partner, always “telegram\_api”

properties.name: request_count
properties.description: The number of successful requests that exceeded regular limits and were therefore billed

objects.name: TransactionPartnerOther
objects.description: Describes a transaction with an unknown source or recipient.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the transaction partner, always “other”

objects.name: StarTransaction
objects.description: Describes a Telegram Star transaction. Note that if the buyer initiates a chargeback with the payment provider from whom they acquired Stars (e.g., Apple, Google) following this transaction, the refunded Stars will be deducted from the bot's balance. This is outside of Telegram's control.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier of the transaction. Coincides with the identifier of the original transaction for refund transactions. Coincides with *SuccessfulPayment.telegram\_payment\_charge\_id* for successful incoming payments from users.

properties.name: amount
properties.description: Integer amount of Telegram Stars transferred by the transaction

properties.name: nanostar_amount
properties.description: *Optional*. The number of 1/1000000000 shares of Telegram Stars transferred by the transaction; from 0 to 999999999

properties.name: date
properties.description: Date the transaction was created in Unix time

properties.name: source
properties.description: *Optional*. Source of an incoming transaction (e.g., a user purchasing goods or services, Fragment refunding a failed withdrawal). Only for incoming transactions

properties.name: receiver
properties.description: *Optional*. Receiver of an outgoing transaction (e.g., a user for a purchase refund, Fragment for a withdrawal). Only for outgoing transactions

objects.name: StarTransactions
objects.description: Contains a list of Telegram Star transactions.

properties.name: transactions
properties.description: The list of transactions

objects.name: PassportData
objects.description: Describes Telegram Passport data shared with the bot by the user.

properties.name: data
properties.description: Array with information about documents and other Telegram Passport elements that was shared with the bot

properties.name: credentials
properties.description: Encrypted credentials required to decrypt the data

objects.name: PassportFile
objects.description: This object represents a file uploaded to Telegram Passport. Currently all Telegram Passport files are in JPEG format when decrypted and don't exceed 10MB.

properties.name: file_id
properties.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file

properties.name: file_unique_id
properties.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: File size in bytes

properties.name: file_date
properties.description: Unix time when the file was uploaded

objects.name: EncryptedPassportElement
objects.description: Describes documents or other Telegram Passport elements shared with the bot by the user.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Element type. One of “personal\_details”, “passport”, “driver\_license”, “identity\_card”, “internal\_passport”, “address”, “utility\_bill”, “bank\_statement”, “rental\_agreement”, “passport\_registration”, “temporary\_registration”, “phone\_number”, “email”.

properties.name: data
properties.description: *Optional*. Base64-encoded encrypted Telegram Passport element data provided by the user; available only for “personal\_details”, “passport”, “driver\_license”, “identity\_card”, “internal\_passport” and “address” types. Can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying [EncryptedCredentials](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#encryptedcredentials).

properties.name: phone_number
properties.description: *Optional*. User's verified phone number; available only for “phone\_number” type

properties.name: email
properties.description: *Optional*. User's verified email address; available only for “email” type

properties.name: files
properties.description: *Optional*. Array of encrypted files with documents provided by the user; available only for “utility\_bill”, “bank\_statement”, “rental\_agreement”, “passport\_registration” and “temporary\_registration” types. Files can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying [EncryptedCredentials](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#encryptedcredentials).

properties.name: front_side
properties.description: *Optional*. Encrypted file with the front side of the document, provided by the user; available only for “passport”, “driver\_license”, “identity\_card” and “internal\_passport”. The file can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying [EncryptedCredentials](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#encryptedcredentials).

properties.name: reverse_side
properties.description: *Optional*. Encrypted file with the reverse side of the document, provided by the user; available only for “driver\_license” and “identity\_card”. The file can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying [EncryptedCredentials](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#encryptedcredentials).

properties.name: selfie
properties.description: *Optional*. Encrypted file with the selfie of the user holding a document, provided by the user; available if requested for “passport”, “driver\_license”, “identity\_card” and “internal\_passport”. The file can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying [EncryptedCredentials](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#encryptedcredentials).

properties.name: translation
properties.description: *Optional*. Array of encrypted files with translated versions of documents provided by the user; available if requested for “passport”, “driver\_license”, “identity\_card”, “internal\_passport”, “utility\_bill”, “bank\_statement”, “rental\_agreement”, “passport\_registration” and “temporary\_registration” types. Files can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying [EncryptedCredentials](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#encryptedcredentials).

properties.name: hash
properties.description: Base64-encoded element hash for using in [PassportElementErrorUnspecified](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#passportelementerrorunspecified)

objects.name: EncryptedCredentials
objects.description: Describes data required for decrypting and authenticating [EncryptedPassportElement](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#encryptedpassportelement). See the [Telegram Passport Documentation](https://core.telegram.org/passport#receiving-information) for a complete description of the data decryption and authentication processes.

properties.name: data
properties.description: Base64-encoded encrypted JSON-serialized data with unique user's payload, data hashes and secrets required for [EncryptedPassportElement](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#encryptedpassportelement) decryption and authentication

properties.name: hash
properties.description: Base64-encoded data hash for data authentication

properties.name: secret
properties.description: Base64-encoded secret, encrypted with the bot's public RSA key, required for data decryption

objects.name: PassportElementError
objects.description:
This object represents an error in the Telegram Passport element which was submitted that should be resolved by the user. It should be one of:

* [PassportElementErrorDataField](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#passportelementerrordatafield)
* [PassportElementErrorFrontSide](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#passportelementerrorfrontside)
* [PassportElementErrorReverseSide](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#passportelementerrorreverseside)
* [PassportElementErrorSelfie](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#passportelementerrorselfie)
* [PassportElementErrorFile](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#passportelementerrorfile)
* [PassportElementErrorFiles](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#passportelementerrorfiles)
* [PassportElementErrorTranslationFile](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#passportelementerrortranslationfile)
* [PassportElementErrorTranslationFiles](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#passportelementerrortranslationfiles)
* [PassportElementErrorUnspecified](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#passportelementerrorunspecified)

objects.name: PassportElementErrorDataField
objects.description: Represents an issue in one of the data fields that was provided by the user. The error is considered resolved when the field's value changes.

properties.name: source
properties.description: Error source, must be *data*

properties.name: type
properties.description: The section of the user's Telegram Passport which has the error, one of “personal\_details”, “passport”, “driver\_license”, “identity\_card”, “internal\_passport”, “address”

properties.name: field_name
properties.description: Name of the data field which has the error

properties.name: data_hash
properties.description: Base64-encoded data hash

properties.name: message
properties.description: Error message

objects.name: PassportElementErrorFrontSide
objects.description: Represents an issue with the front side of a document. The error is considered resolved when the file with the front side of the document changes.

properties.name: source
properties.description: Error source, must be *front\_side*

properties.name: type
properties.description: The section of the user's Telegram Passport which has the issue, one of “passport”, “driver\_license”, “identity\_card”, “internal\_passport”

properties.name: file_hash
properties.description: Base64-encoded hash of the file with the front side of the document

properties.name: message
properties.description: Error message

objects.name: PassportElementErrorReverseSide
objects.description: Represents an issue with the reverse side of a document. The error is considered resolved when the file with reverse side of the document changes.

properties.name: source
properties.description: Error source, must be *reverse\_side*

properties.name: type
properties.description: The section of the user's Telegram Passport which has the issue, one of “driver\_license”, “identity\_card”

properties.name: file_hash
properties.description: Base64-encoded hash of the file with the reverse side of the document

properties.name: message
properties.description: Error message

objects.name: PassportElementErrorSelfie
objects.description: Represents an issue with the selfie with a document. The error is considered resolved when the file with the selfie changes.

properties.name: source
properties.description: Error source, must be *selfie*

properties.name: type
properties.description: The section of the user's Telegram Passport which has the issue, one of “passport”, “driver\_license”, “identity\_card”, “internal\_passport”

properties.name: file_hash
properties.description: Base64-encoded hash of the file with the selfie

properties.name: message
properties.description: Error message

objects.name: PassportElementErrorFile
objects.description: Represents an issue with a document scan. The error is considered resolved when the file with the document scan changes.

properties.name: source
properties.description: Error source, must be *file*

properties.name: type
properties.description: The section of the user's Telegram Passport which has the issue, one of “utility\_bill”, “bank\_statement”, “rental\_agreement”, “passport\_registration”, “temporary\_registration”

properties.name: file_hash
properties.description: Base64-encoded file hash

properties.name: message
properties.description: Error message

objects.name: PassportElementErrorFiles
objects.description: Represents an issue with a list of scans. The error is considered resolved when the list of files containing the scans changes.

properties.name: source
properties.description: Error source, must be *files*

properties.name: type
properties.description: The section of the user's Telegram Passport which has the issue, one of “utility\_bill”, “bank\_statement”, “rental\_agreement”, “passport\_registration”, “temporary\_registration”

properties.name: file_hashes
properties.description: List of base64-encoded file hashes

properties.name: message
properties.description: Error message

objects.name: PassportElementErrorTranslationFile
objects.description: Represents an issue with one of the files that constitute the translation of a document. The error is considered resolved when the file changes.

properties.name: source
properties.description: Error source, must be *translation\_file*

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of element of the user's Telegram Passport which has the issue, one of “passport”, “driver\_license”, “identity\_card”, “internal\_passport”, “utility\_bill”, “bank\_statement”, “rental\_agreement”, “passport\_registration”, “temporary\_registration”

properties.name: file_hash
properties.description: Base64-encoded file hash

properties.name: message
properties.description: Error message

objects.name: PassportElementErrorTranslationFiles
objects.description: Represents an issue with the translated version of a document. The error is considered resolved when a file with the document translation change.

properties.name: source
properties.description: Error source, must be *translation\_files*

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of element of the user's Telegram Passport which has the issue, one of “passport”, “driver\_license”, “identity\_card”, “internal\_passport”, “utility\_bill”, “bank\_statement”, “rental\_agreement”, “passport\_registration”, “temporary\_registration”

properties.name: file_hashes
properties.description: List of base64-encoded file hashes

properties.name: message
properties.description: Error message

objects.name: PassportElementErrorUnspecified
objects.description: Represents an issue in an unspecified place. The error is considered resolved when new data is added.

properties.name: source
properties.description: Error source, must be *unspecified*

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of element of the user's Telegram Passport which has the issue

properties.name: element_hash
properties.description: Base64-encoded element hash

properties.name: message
properties.description: Error message

objects.name: Game
objects.description: This object represents a game. Use BotFather to create and edit games, their short names will act as unique identifiers.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Title of the game

properties.name: description
properties.description: Description of the game

properties.name: photo
properties.description: Photo that will be displayed in the game message in chats.

properties.name: text
properties.description: *Optional*. Brief description of the game or high scores included in the game message. Can be automatically edited to include current high scores for the game when the bot calls [setGameScore](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#setgamescore), or manually edited using [editMessageText](https://core.telegram.org/bots/api/#editmessagetext). 0-4096 characters.

properties.name: text_entities
properties.description: *Optional*. Special entities that appear in *text*, such as usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc.

properties.name: animation
properties.description: *Optional*. Animation that will be displayed in the game message in chats. Upload via [BotFather](https://t.me/botfather)

objects.name: CallbackGame
objects.description: A placeholder, currently holds no information. Use [BotFather](https://t.me/botfather) to set up your game.

objects.name: GameHighScore
objects.description: This object represents one row of the high scores table for a game.

properties.name: position
properties.description: Position in high score table for the game

properties.name: user
properties.description: User

properties.name: score
properties.description: Score
